Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Pearl Hill!”
Reviews.Author: Promtong
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on Pearl Hill! Away from busy Singapore. Nice room. Good sleep. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No frills no fuss”
Reviews.Author: AmsColombo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Re! on business for about 5 days. The rooms were small but comfortable and there's pretty good wifi available which is free to all guests which is a definite value point. Their conference room was spacious though and as it is away from the city its quite peaceful too. You are a 10 minute walk away from the MRT and the hotel is quite close to Chinatown (20 minute walk). Food is alright but it is a no frills no fuss place so don't expect to be pampered. There's a small gym too (about 3-4 machines) but no one ever seems to go so you can exercise in privacy. If you are paying in cash then you are expected to pay for your stay upfront but I was able to pay 50% on arrival and then the balance at check out

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: friendlytrips
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive when booking this hotel before the trip. All I had to go on was a map, and did not know if this hotel was centrally located and how far from everything! From the airport it was a 20.00 Singapore dollars ride. The hotel is a short 4 minutes walk from China town and a short 6 minutes walk to the MRT subway station: OUTRAM PARK. With this in mind this hotel is thus very centrally located. It is within easy reach of Little India, Orchard Road Shopping area, as well as Kampong Glam, the Arab Area and the Marina Area, which is home to the Sands Hotel with a viewing platform up 57 stories. The staff at the Hotel Re is very pleasant and professional as well as helpful. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are equally clean. We stayed in room 1206 with a nice view toward "downtown" Some people complain about the size of the rooms. We found it spacious, in fact much bigger than most hotels in Europe that charge twice as much. I use a hotel to sleep and shower. I know the next time I am in Singapore I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthAgent86
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was very funky... the designs around the place all kept with a retro theme. They provided a couple of complementary snacks in room which is a nice change. We only stayed a night but I wouldn't of minded it to have been longer. We were given a complementary room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price/Quality/Location Option For Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Re! on three occasions now, and last time I was there I got an upgrade to a suite, presumably because my name was already in the hotel's records. I have stayed at a couple of other places in Singapore, but I find the Hotel Re! is modern, and I really like the retro theme they have going. The regular rooms are of a reasonable size, and when I stayed in them I certainly wasn't cramped, and their suites are quite large, with a big ensuite bathroom, and ante-room leading to the bedroom. In the suite, I had some mixed results with the wi-fi on one occasion, but this was solved by just going down to the lobby with my laptop. However, now I have an iPhone, which might be annoying if the wi-fi was a little dodgy, but maybe it was just a fault that day. On the two other occasions I stayed there, I found no such problem. The rooms are very clean, and well air-conditioned, and at a fair price. There are some room snacks & drinks, but I didn't indulge. The breakfast bar is pretty good, although one thing that disappointed me last time was that the scrambled eggs had all sorts of wierd stuff in them, and the chef refused to cook me some plain scrambled eggs when I asked (even though he wasn't busy at the time). I had asked and received plain scrambled eggs on the two previous trips that I was there, so I hope the Hotel Re! can make it so that you just get plain scrambled eggs. However, try the watermelon juice they serve - that is great. I also liked the bar, which I think was located on the 5th floor. It's a great place to watch English Premier League games, although the beer was a little overpriced. I paid something like $12sg for a Hoegaarden beer. Hotel Re! is located right by the Outram Park MRT, and therefore, provides easy access to the rest of Singapore island (this MRT services two metro lines). I left the hotel via the MRT, took a bus across the causeway, and was in Johore Bahru (Malaysia) within an hour. From Outram Park MRT, there is a direct train to Changi Airport, and I found it took about half an hour from hotel to departure hall. It should be pointed out that to get to Hotel Re! from Outram Park MRT, you take the road that flanks the park heading up to Pearl's Hill, but continue walking almost to the Central Expressway. There is a small cul-de-sac to the right about 50m before you reach the expressway, so take that, go up the concrete steps (sometimes awkward with luggage !), and you are in the Hotel Re! carpark. Google Maps shows adequately where the Hotel Re! is located. Having stayed at the Hotel Re!, I wouldn't consider another option at this point. I am most likely returning to Singapore in the middle of 2012, and I will again be booking at the Hotel Re! - I hope I get a suite again !

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denny L
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Re!. I’m satisfied with this hotel during my vacation. The hotel price is not too expensive if we want to compare with what we got in this hotel. Once I entered the hotel, it was so impressed to look on their retro design. I found the staffs to be fantastic and any issues about my reservations & rooms that needed addressing were rectified promptly by the front desk staff & duty manager. The location is great as it is close to Outram MRT Station and some of Singapore most popular sights, The gym & spa were also standout features of this hotel. The rooms were a bit on the small side but quite functional. Buffet breakfast could have been better but it was ok! My problems were at second night where wifi was not reliable & I was disturbed by the loud noises which had been made by the engineering staffs in the evening (8-9.30 pm). They fixed or did maintenance on hotel hallway or ceilings.It was totally unpleasant. Nothing great but not that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: antyloopa
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 8 nights in february. Room was tiny but clean. the location is a bit away from the center but you can walk in 10 min to Chinatown or 15 min to Clark Quay. it takes 10 min to walk to nearest metro station (Outram) or just take free hotel shuttle ( which we used a lot). Room service closes at 10:30 pm and your only option for a late night food is mcdonalds which delivers quickly to the hotel for $4 and is open 24h/7. Staff was helpful when needed, but never greeted you when you walk by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful and friendly stay!”
Reviews.Author: popcorndees
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and truly enjoyed the experience. First impression on arrival was the bright and colorful surroundings. Allocated a green room which was my favourite color! The reception staff were exceptional and provides very efficient checking in and out. Porters were helpful with the baggages and taxis. Restaurant food with good choices and varieties. Will definitely return back on my next visit here!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and OTT design”
Reviews.Author: spotuv
Reviews.Content: Rooms are overcharged, limited tv channels, bedlinens feel very cheap. Bathroom design is poor. No room service to speak of. Front desk's attitude was poor. Can spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Modern and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KandyKitten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stop over for 4 days and although intially we thought we were in the middle of no where, inactual fact we were just at the back of China Town which gave us great access to the rest of Singapore and to the wonderful People Food Court! The hotel is very funky retro in design, so not to everyone's taste but is is fresh and different. The rooms were great, had everything from air-con, all toiletries in the bathroom, satallite TV and complimentary snacks and drinks. The food in the restaurante leaves litte to be desired but as mentioned above you are only a hop and a skip from the People's Food Court in China Town and can eat like a king for next to nothing. The Hotel also has a fitness centre, spa and free bus transfer to Orchard Road (shopping street) but ask at Reception as there was no info in the rooms so we didn't find out until it was too late. All in all a lovely hotel with very comfortable beds and friendly helpful staff. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Ageing hipster”
Reviews.Author: MajorKusanagi
Reviews.Content: Booked online for 4 nights on hotel web-site starting from the 3rd of January, 2012. Upon arrival, noted overpowering smell of air freshener in the lobby. Check-in reception allocated us Room 1011, apparently one of their Business Rooms. Upon entering the room, found false eye-lashes from previous guest in bath-tub...disgusting. Poorly designed bathroom door spontaneously opens outwards. No way to close the door from outside the bathroom. Bathroom fixtures flimsy with exposed pipework. Bedside lamp faulty, pillows hard and thick, poor TV reception, only 1 pair of slippers and 1 bathrobe for 2 guests. Bathrobe stained and frayed. Curtains have gaps and walls are thin enough to hear neighbors having a shower or talking. Newspaper delivery erratic. Air-conditioning vent vanes pointing directly at the bed and not adjustable. So one either turns the air-con on and freezes or turn it off and bakes. Check-out staff communicated with male guest only, female guest made to feel invisible even though she was settling the account using her credit card. In summation, this hotel is overrated. It unfortunately makes the short-list as one of the most tackiest hotels I've stayed in. Will try somewhere else when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better with such a price paid for one night”
Reviews.Author: Taitaijane
Reviews.Content: 1. Limited carpark lots with huge ants crawling in one particular lot 2. Long waiting time at the reception as only one receptionist was mending the counter 3. Room is small, complimentary mini bar is a total letdown with only small packet of twistie, prawn cracker and two non chilled coke 4. No provision of cotton earbud in toilet 5. Telephone set instruction unclear, called guest service to ask for extra shower gel and waited for one hr before I made a second call 6. Selection of DVDs is limited and most of the titles are unavailable 7. The only good thing about hotel re is their signature laksa and chicken pie. Bonus is they carry loccitane toiletries! 8. I will not pay close to $300 for such a business room

Reviews.Title: “Fun little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aitana24ve
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was pretty fun and interesting. My son loved it! It is pretty close to subway and is not that expensive considering it is Singapore, hotels are generally a lot more expensive than they would be anywhere else in SE Asia.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places.”
Reviews.Author: Teirrah
Reviews.Content: In a city of phenomenally expensive hotels, this was the best value I could find that had consistently good reviews and availability for my dates. However, there were drawbacks: for $150 I expected more than a shoebox, a shoebox that felt like sleeping on the set of Austin Powers and with a motorway right outside my window. Surprise costs at the end: tax and ‘service’: should have been clearer when signing up. Water heating that takes 15 minutes to warm before taking a shower. ‘Fitness room’ that consists of a single running machine and one other machine which I forget. I would have been happy if the room had cost half as much. There must be better places in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms but a little pricey and unexpected rudeness”
Reviews.Author: lana190
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. We chose it because we had three people in our party and it was one of the few places that had triple rooms. I was pleasantly surprised by the beds/bedding and overall layout of the room. We used this as a hub for traveling. It's located about a 10 min walk from Outram MRT but, a word of caution: If you have someone elderly in your party, you may want to rethink this hotel. The walk is entirely uphill and can be quite tiring. Not a fault of the hotel, though. The only thing I was let down about was the unexpected rudeness we received. A female friend of mind had made all the reservations and plans but when she approached the male concierge to ask questions, he promptly IGNORED her and addressed questions and answers to the only male in our party. The check-in staff even asked our male counterpart for his credit card even though the reservation was made with one of our female friend's credit card. We were really surprised to encounter such blatant sexism in Singapore. Price is a little high for what this hotel offers but once we got around the sexism issue by letting the male do all the talking, the hotel was happy to hire cabs for us and tell us where we needed to go. However, I pity the all-female party who comes to this hotel. I wonder how they would treat them?

Reviews.Title: “OK But !”
Reviews.Author: CozfromOz
Reviews.Content: I booked this because it was well priced and based on the web information...but what I found but was free minibar means a can of Coke and a packet of prawn chips, free cable TV was about 8 channels with only 3 in English. Bizarrely decorated in Orange & Purple. Close to Chinatown but not much else. On the plus side, Internet was good (and included) , Bed was comfortable and a shuttle to the closest staion (Outram Park) Probably would not stay there again, the bright colours were a bit much for me!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dreatycj
Reviews.Content: It's not worth the money to stay in this hotel. It has insufficient parking lots for guest. We waited for almost half and hour for the parking lot and we were told by phone upon reservation that we could request for a complimentary late check out however, we we not given so.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: cocopopp
Reviews.Content: Coming in from a resort beach suite, we were happy to have a clean room to sleep in. It is more expensive than the resort prices?! Found hair in the shower, free internet was a plus and use the shuttle service. Train station not too far, very cheap to use public transport.

Reviews.Title: “ok but...”
Reviews.Author: salthound
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Re! and I have stayed there several times before. In common with all Singpaore hotels, it is a little expensive but the location is good with only a short walk to Clarke Quay and the main attarctions of Singapore - Chinatown is very close. At this stay at the hotel, found that the aircon did not function well - a key requirement for a westerner in Singapore! The room, however was comfortable and the stylish decoration of the hotel is interesting! This hotel has become increasingly expensive as it begins to establish itself - the cost for what you are getting is now a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel Deserves Respect”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: First stay in this boutique hotel off Chin Swee road, nearby to clarke quay and the river front. A very clean, well maintained boutique hotel that is nicely set up and new. Friendly staff. Not a busy hotel that is slightly off the city center but a short 15 minute taxi ride to orchard road and key area's in the city. Outram Park MRT station is a 10 minute walk with visible signages to guide you to the station but remember WHICH exit to take to come out of the MRT so you don't end up at a different exit point away from the one closest to the hotel. Would def. stay at this hotel in the future. Check out their nasi goreng (with satay) which is very good. The satay is FRESH and not frozen (you can tell when it's fresh vs frozen and re-heated) whilst their chicken pie is also a nice touch if you want something light.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indurao
Reviews.Content: Have been staying often at this small boutique hotel on Chinswee road, very close to Otram park MRT. Great place for young travellers, and small groups and conferences. Central location, takes just 15 mins to Orchard street. The hotel decor is bright and fresh. Has the people s park garden if you are a walker just across. Walking distance to China town. If you want a bit more fancy, walk to Clark's Quay

Reviews.Title: “Retro stay”
Reviews.Author: Jude7_11
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic boutique hotel to find in Singapore. Hotel Re! has well-appointed rooms including complimentary mini-bar and with very clean bathrooms attached. There are excellent facilties available for guests throughout the hotel. The location is ideal - overlooking the Outram Park - which gives a lovely green outlook from your hotel room, and bordering Chinatown. It's also a short walk from the train station. Staff are very helpful - taxis are available within minutes of requests - a very helpful concierge service. The only downside was that when we tried to book into the spa, despite the best efforts of reception staff, the spa wasn't open despite it being during advertised opening hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: hdt99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel with a very helpful and friendly staff. I stayed for 1 day and had to leave the next morning at 4 am to catch a flight. The hotel staff was very helpful in accommodating my unusual checkout time. I didn't really check out the amenities of the hotel too much but the decor was a bit funky and the hotel spotless. The only negative is the location. It's on top of a big hill so it'll be quite a walk for you in the sweltering Singaporean heat.

Reviews.Title: “colorful”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: despite the sometimes neon-y colors the rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable. friendly staff and good location

Reviews.Title: “Unique stay in this wonderfully tucked away boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotterg6
Reviews.Content: Nice scenery around hotel, love the fresh air! Very unique decoration, alot of effort went into the design. Excellent service with many cheerful and knowledgeable staff

Reviews.Title: “Family Suite”
Reviews.Author: dybl_0644
Reviews.Content: It cannot be considered a Boutique Hotel after you had stayed in Naumi or Wangz for comparison. When step in the lobby, it had a over sweet smell that I couldn't stand. The overall design doesn't give me a Boutique feel but cheap feel that is overrated and overpriced. For a Family Suite, the room is very very small for the high price and without breakfast inclusive. Not worth it. Will not return to try even the theme room. Spend the money in Festive Hotel for family suite more worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Re!ally good experience”
Reviews.Author: Wackyb6
Reviews.Content: This boutique property first impressed on its shuttle bus service from the subway. It was a convenient 5 mins drive to the hotel and was on schedule as per published on their website (although we discovered later that it took a little more than 7 minutes to walk from the hotel to the subway if we didn't want to wait for the shuttle bus). Bright colours greeted us when we first stepped into the lobby and the conceirge promptly assisted with our luggage. Check-in was fuss free and we were in our bright green rooms in 10 mins. The room size was comfortable although not exactly big but value for money. Breakfast had a decent spread and staff were prompt to replenish items when we came down late for breakfast. The service for this hotel really impresses (from attentive F&B to cheerful housekeepers) as for the value paid, we were expecting more budget than anything. Will certainly return to try its other theme rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy cramped confused hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Gal1868
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel I will not stay in even for free. Rooms are small, beds are small single beds (makes you wonder why they even bother furnishing the room with 2 beds..) And neon pink, green... everywhere!! The room gave me headache from day 1 itself. Company had conference there due cheap rates and that is all there is to this hotel. Wifi line kept dropping at the conference hall. On 2nd day, they served the same dessert from day 1, and it was stale!! When we confronted the hotel staffs, we were told it was made fresh but they themselves refused to taste it. Even though it is near outran and tiong bahru, walking to the nearest let is not a smart decision as the hotel is on a hill side. A simple fish and chips at the hotel restaurant took more than 1/2 hour to be served and when they serve it, the fish was over fried.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Walton_SA
Reviews.Content: I had a 4 day stop-over in Singapore and decided on Hotel Re! The hotel was well located, a short distance to all the city’s main hubs, including Orchard St. and the Marina Bay. There is a large beautiful park right next to the hotel, brilliant for a walk and some tranquility. The rooms were clean, fresh and colorful, giving the whole hotel a modern and exciting feel. Food in the restaurant was excellent! When we departed, in the rush, I forgot some jewelry and my iPhone in the hotel safe, only realizing this when arrived in South Africa. I immediately contacted the Hotel, and the office manager couriered the items to me within 12 hours of my email. All arrived, and I am still astounded by the service and efficiency I received. I would recommend Hotel Re! to anyone who visits Singapore. Clean, modern and well located. Having such efficient, honest and friendly staff, makes the stay even so much better :)

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels for the same price”
Reviews.Author: daikimatsu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit shabby and bit out of place for a business traveler. It's quite far off from the road and the nearest MRT (metro) station is a long walk downhill (and back uphill is a very difficult walk if you are in a business attire). The rooms were VERY VERY small and the bathroom were like aircraft lavatories. The setup was little shabby for that price. Not recommended for business traveler. Leisure travelers can try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable, pleasant and attentive”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the cleanest hotels in Singapore. The bathrooms are spotless, the beds comfortable. The staff is remarkably pleasant and attentive. There is free wi-fi ( a bit slow at times). It not accessible by bus but there is scheduled shuttle service to the nearest MRT station. It is situated next to a lovely park on a hill and the bus station is a leisurely stroll down a shady walkway. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: champkis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. It's a really funky hotel, very modern. Location is good- it's not slap bang in the middle but only about a 12 minute ish walk to Clarke Quay which is a lovely place to stroll around (with lots of restaurants to choose from). The hotel is on a bit of a hill but it didn't bother me. Taxi costs about 8singapore dollars from Marina Sans Bay for 3 people. It's a ten minute walk to outram park MRT station and there is a free shuttle bus. The breakfast was good- fresh and repleneshed frequently. Staff were fantastic- so helpful and they always smiled and said hello. We had a triple room and it wad a good size- not huge but plenty of space to put our bags out of the way. I would stay in this hotel again- I definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: SurabhiMehta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked in urgency for a work trip and due to some confusion, the booking was for 2 days first and then 1 day seperately for 3 continuous days. The hotel staff could not understand this in 1 go but had to be explained about it twice Inspite of this, they made me shift my room for the 3rd nite The system to call a taxi is not organized either. The interiors have a splash of colors which are not tastefully done its is supposed to be a boutique hotel and you expect the the property to be designed well..it is not! my stay was ok but I dont want to go back there for sure

Reviews.Title: “Nice surrounding & Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Noshe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when we went there for some medical checkup. The hotel has nice, bright decoration, rooms are clean and the surrounding area is also very peaceful as just beside the hotel there is a park. From our room window the park was visible. You can walk up to the nearest station is 10 mins by walking through the park. Though the hotel is a bit away from city center but it does not make any difference as most important locations are well connected. But only problem is you have to walk 10 mins to reach the station. So if you are Ok with walking to reach the destination then this hotel is a good option as their other facilities are good. Hotels in Singapore are very expensive as compared to other countries and as this hotel is a bit away from city center the cost is relatively lower than other hotels. So would recommend for travelers who does not mind walking up to the station to commute and yet wants to stay in a hotel with better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “cute design, affordable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Cher-Sze
Reviews.Content: Hotel ReI is located at the outskirts of Outram MRT (which is very near Chinatown, tourist attraction) It used to be a school building but was remodified to be a hotel. Price: Budget, per room (im talking about the normal ones) is around 200+.. PROS: Location: its on a hill, so fresh air for all! they provide a shuttle bus to various mrt locations. but its a tad inconvenient if you want to walk up to the hotel on your own Rooms: the rooms are uniquely designed and pretty CONS: Lift: the lift is rather small and slow. Location: good location but does not have a lot of public transport nearby. Conclusion: Good place to stay in if you wanna do a budget trip but still get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Colourful qwirky place”
Reviews.Author: arundhoti
Reviews.Content: This hotel really stands out with all the pink color. Each floor has a different color code and mine was pink. The rooms are a tad small, but the decor and the overall nice feeling makes up for it. The free wi-fi is a good help. Room service for 24 hours is nice esp. since I was working through late night. The restaurant has a good offering and the buffet breakfast platter is good. The hotel is located quite close to the business district and take around 10 minutes in the morning to reach there. It is also walking distance from Clarke Quay. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WILL THINK TWICE”
Reviews.Author: deedenz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week to attended a course program. No welcome drinks, small room, no swimming pool, bad foods (have same menu for breakfast, lunch, dinner for a week stayed), bad coffee break snacks. You need to walk about 10 minutes to get the MRT station. The only thing I like from this hotel was the fresh air outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique Boutique Hotel that worth staying”
Reviews.Author: Tonyong1412
Reviews.Content: This unique boutique hotel located at the heart of Singapore Town Centre and yet away from the noisy business/commercial district. The location is very convenience to access to the CBD or shopping district. The hotel service was very friendly and the the room was also unique design and prepared. I will definitely stay in this hotel again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “a good and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: joyfang
Reviews.Content: i'm not sure why the other reviews depicted such a bad picture. i had a room upgrade and stayed in the Business Room, which was pretty big and comfortable. the sheets and toilet were clean and everything was very comfortable. the only downside is that the hotel is located at the top of the hill, which might make travelling there abit difficult. but a simple taxi ride from Outram MRT would cost very little. i liked that the hotel was abit reclusive - it made a relaxing and quiet stay away from the busy city centre, which could be reached in just 10mins. the massage and facial which came with the package was also great, but the spa centre is small, there's only one masseuse and one facial therapist, which might make the wait pretty long. overall though, it was pleasant and i enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Only RE! grets......”
Reviews.Author: hirahmanramli
Reviews.Content: This is what i experienced, Checked in late to the hotel, at the counter while the recept was attending to me, phone rang , she answered n made me wait for her for like 5 mins. Got into the so called executive suite, the room was really small for a suite. Wall papers starting to peel off from the wall. The room was super humid... Tv controller nowhere to be found. Called for help, they send up the tv controller n an engineer came to fix the aircon which later cause the false ceiling to have a huge crack. Told him to clean it up before he leaves. In his words " Tmrrow can? , housekeeping go home already n i got no broom". The next day, front desk called n confirmed with me a time at Re!fresh , their so called spa. only to get a call an hour later saying that they have to postpone my time due to them overlooking the appointment time. Got to the spa, only to have me wait for like 10 minutes more due to them have only 1 female therapist for my gf and that therapist was attending to someone.To summarise everything if u are thinking of hotel RE! for your future holiday or escape, forget it you'll have more fun at home.

Reviews.Title: “RE-GRET”
Reviews.Author: ILoveUnicorns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Upon reaching the place, was quite impressed with the decor of the lobby. Staff at the reception was not helpful, seemed edgy and was EXTREMELY rude. She picked up a call on the phone and talked while doing our reservation. When I wanted to clarify some things, her tone was simply uncalled for. I do not remember her name, I wished I did though so I could mention it here. Staffs generally DON'T smile and don't acknowledge you. Rooms look like some budget/transit hotels. For an executive suite, it looked just like their superior room, only exception was that it had a bathtub. Disgusting view of rusty air conditioning vents out our window. Food spread during breakfast buffet was ok. Only 2 staffs in the area, only 1 managed a smile at us. Took a long time to refill the food and clear the plates. We booked the package RE Treat which comes with a massage session. Only 1 could converse in English (like seriously) and others kept conversing in Mandarin to us. Massage was horrible, I don't feel relaxed, and at one point, I know they switched the masseuse for me, hands felt different. The other one, the lady, went to do some manicure on another guest. Huge disappointment though so much hype has been on this hotel in the media and all. Don't go, or you will RE-GRET!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms,dirty sheets & towels,inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: windyhabour
Reviews.Content: Where can I start,when we arrived we were made to sign a declararation that we would not smoke in the room & not bring in some local fruit.On arrivingin ourtiny room it stunk of cig. smoke.Wecalled reception who sent up the maid whocould not smell thecig.smoke or so she claimed. Therooms are really tiny,not recommended for couples only single.In our 5 day stay sheets only changed once! No curtains in room only cheap roll up blinds that let the light in through the gaps at 7 AM! Some towels & our once changed sheets had yellow stains on them.The location is really very inconvenient on top of a hill far from anything.And the rate is very expensive for what it is.I also never heard of a 4 star hotel with NO POOL!!Dont stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Tacky beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: Meerabel
Reviews.Content: This is a themed hotel - think 'Austin Powers' meets 'Boogie Nights'. Apart from the appalling decor, the place was not in a good state of repair - the finish was very cheap and quite run-down. It is in a very 'local' area; China Town is within walking distance, but otherwise it is removed from the central tourist and business district (only about 5 minutes by car, but it was too far to walk given the surroundings - I attempted it once but didn't feel safe). The staff mean well, and were friendly and helpful, but getting anything accomplished was an ordeal. Every time I called for room service, my call would be held from person to person and placed on hold for so long that I would have to hang up and start all over again. One morning, they got my room service order wrong 3 times when all I wanted was 2 slices of brown toast with jam and a small plate of fruit - then they charged me S$27 for it. When I checked out, I was in a hurry to get to the airport and asked for a porter to help with my large suitcases. 3 calls and 15 minutes later, I gave up and took them down myself. Due to the nature of my business trip (Singapore-KL-Singapore), I had the misfortune of being booked in this hotel twice in one week. I tried to cancel my booking for the latter half of the stay, but agoda.com charged twice the nightly rate as a cancellation fee (don't get me started). Both times, I requested a double room but was placed in a twin room with 2 single beds which could not even be pushed together. What baffled me was that both rooms I stayed in each had a 40 inch flat-screen Panasonic TV - assuming this was the case in all the rooms, I wonder if the money could not have been better spent on refurbishing the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good service”
Reviews.Author: S_Chew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Premier Room 1202 on the 1st night, clean, spacious but the bed was old and soft, pillows were not good. Next morning we requested change of room and the staff immediately attended to our request and we got Room 802, the bed was perfect but I still don't prefer the quality of the pillows. All in all, the hotel is about 10 mins walk to Outram MRT via a dark and small road from the back of hotel car park, ladies please don't walk alone. Good to have free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest marketing, indifferent service and average food”
Reviews.Author: dt17
Reviews.Content: Complaints In point form • Rooms a little small, walls are thin • Average food • Indifferent service at the massage and during dinner • Dishonest marketing • Location not great Booked a package with dinner, one night stay and massage. DO NOT go for their promotion package as you can get cheaper rates and better deal if you book their services individually online. Disappointed at their marketing gimmicks and dishonesty In summary, not worth the money i paid, possible to get more value from other hotels in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Small Clean Room, Location Not Good”
Reviews.Author: pkhappy
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in Hotel Re! during the Chinese New Year for S$175, this price is relatively cheap when comparing with other 4-star hotel around the area. Once arrived I found the location was not very good. It was on a small hill and not close to MRT station. It says there is a complimentry shuttle bus but the service was not frequent. Luckily its situated on the edge of Chinatown so its easy to travel by taxi to Robertson/Clarke/Boat Quay , the CBD and also the Marina Bay. For the room, it was very tiny but it doesnt matter for me as long as it was very clean with everything I need. The pressure of the shower was great, I had a nice shower. The pillows were a little bit too soft but still ok. There was also a LCD flat screen TV and free Wifi (though it is slow but better than nothing). The hotel staff was very nice especially the ball boy was very helpful with lifting our luggages and helping us to arrange taxi.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel - highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer-Starry
Reviews.Content: I must say I enjoyed my stay in Hotel Re alots! It is a very trendy hotel which is targeted on younger generation though. It is about 10 minutes walking distance from Outram Park MRT station to Hotel Re! No need to worry that you can't find Hotel Re! as there're signages (in Pink!) to tell you the direction to the hotel. The hotel is located on the top of a hill (no worries about the hill, more like a jogging practice :p) The service provided by Receptionist was good, pls take note that you'd require to provide passports (you & people who stay in the hotel) for them to make a copy for filing. I booked a room for 2 person but out of my surprised, I was given a triple room! As I was expecting the room to be small & tiny but I was really happy that they upgraded my room without having to pay a cent! I like the room design, especially the beds which are so comfortable! The only disadvantage is there was water leaking from the ceiling which did not bother a lot as I merely stayed for 1 night. Overall, I enjoyed my stay & I'd definitely stay in Hotel Re! for my next visit to Singapore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please Re - view your selection before booking this shoe box!!!”
Reviews.Author: Watsons-Bay
Reviews.Content: The only boutique reference in the hotel would be the word in the sales brochure, the rooms are sub-standard, miniscule in size, beds ordinary and the glaring sickly pink the hotel leaves you with a most distressing impression. Honestly for all the hotel selection in Singapore this Hotel represents terrible value, location and style.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Uthaya_10
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were there for a half-day meeting. The facilities were very retro looking, clean and chic, and the Sales Manager, Jessica Ong, did a fantastic job in arranging for her staff to promptly take care of all arrangements for the meeting . Tea-break , and the lunch (a 4 course set meal) was above average. Special mention goes to hotel staff Mr Ruthun Sun who was on standby throughout the meeting to assist us. Good place to hold small corporate group meetings. Complimentary Parking and Wireless made it even more convenient for our meeting. Cheers, Ang.

Reviews.Title: “The Japan- size room.”
Reviews.Author: 2Adults3Kids
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re! Is a very retro type hotel. The room is very small. At least for two people. Because it is small, it is cozy. I stayed there with my sister for 4 days. The breakfast was average and there is wifi in the room. The only problem was that sometimes the hotel card woudnt work and we needed to change it and the location to the subway is a distance if you walk. There is a shuttle but when you walk it is tiring. It is kind of a waste of money to use taxi coz it is not far by car.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for money, we Love it”
Reviews.Author: Desjou
Reviews.Content: 1) The pressure point massage is perfect for fatigue body 2) but the counter staff (receptionist) are not friendly enough 3) we love the room where decor with beetles theme & huge bed 4) the sumptuous 5 course candlelight dinner is perfect celebration for anniversary

Reviews.Title: “The best deal money can buy”
Reviews.Author: hrh747
Reviews.Content: Free WIFI in the room, near China town, near supermarket, near metro station, near park, safe deposit in the room, great breakfast in the morning, short walking distance to fine dinning, the rooms are small but that's not a problem, extremely clean rooms, friendly staff. I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel worth consideration in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: denpasar52
Reviews.Content: I had a Deluxe Room, very small but quite good as was the bathroom. Internet was free and fast, television reception was troubled with on/off reception and with only a few channels anyway, mini-bar expensive (an 80 cent can of coke for $3), service was good and the hotel is bright and colorful. Can be noisy at night when people return to their rooms. It is good 15 minute walk (uphill) from Outram MRT Station although there is a free Shuttle Bus which runs regularly during the day. Breakfast was included with my room and was pretty good and the restaurant downstairs seemed to be busy all day so perhaps the food is good all day long. Happy Hours Bar is great as far as location but once again expensive even in Happy Hours - no wonder it was always empty.

Reviews.Title: “Retro design, but not 100% up to business travellers expectations”
Reviews.Author: altkoenig1975
Reviews.Content: Tried this place as it looked quite nice on the internet. Attracts mainly a young crowd, but not really a good choice for serious business people. Might use this again if I travel for pleasure, but not for business (eg. no pressing service). Location is a 10-15 minutes walk from China Town, but the direct neighbourhood is not so nice (except for the park right next to it). Also found the Air Conditioning in my room difficult to adjust to create a pleasant climate (either very cold breeze, or off), but this could have been just my room. In light of the decent price (compared to other hotels), I would recommend this for young people seeking a "hip" place, and who do not mind being not really central and close to the business districts.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveDubai2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel: clean but small rooms. Very modern. The breakfast is pretty pricey and not to special, but there are other places you can have breakfast. Walking distance to Chinatown and public transportation. Very modern and clean hotel. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, funky rooms. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: catandmattBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Comfortable bed, clean room and bathroom. Everyone was really friendly and the hotel restaurant served some great food. Just a short walk to the MRT station and China town. Had a great time and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kurrant_by
Reviews.Content: for its price, the location and rooms are great. very clean and stylish, stuff very helpful. close to chinatown and orchard road (30 min walk). breakfast was ok, but for this money better buy breakfast somewhere else. booked through expedia and the hotel's site had better rates actually

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quite, friendly, good location - don't expect anything else”
Reviews.Author: MarieLou89
Reviews.Content: The size/ design/ shape of the hotel rooms reminds me of student accommodation (they can't help it being previously a school and then student hostel), but they have jazz it up with funky design (check out their website) . It's very clean overall, nice & quite location on it's own away from the hustle and bustle, 5-10 minutes walk to Outram Park MRT (it's very near), and very near Chinatown & Clark Quay (less than Sing$10 taxi cab ride away). We stayed at the Family Suite with sufficient space for 4 adults to move around, sufficient storage for suitcases & clothes, and they have 42 Inch LCD TV & DVD player in the room. Nice bright clean bathroom with a bathtub and L'Occitane shower gel/ shampoo (I heard only for more expensive rooms). Staff were helpful, there was something wrong with the light and they came to fix it right away when called. Also when asked for small things like to reset safe/ extra towels etc, no fuss. The price is a bit high for such a hotel, kept me wondering if staying at Studio M would be better (it's about 10 minutes walk away), as this hotel has no pool and not as posh for the price.

Reviews.Title: “very nice beds”
Reviews.Author: oldsport79
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights. rooms were quite small but it didn't matter as we only slept there. rooms were clean and fresh. beds were extremely comfortable we slept very good even though we were very jetlagged. it's NOT a long walk to the subway, the people who claim that must be fat and out of shape. the walk up the hill with a 18 kg backback took like 5 minutes as is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirgenM
Reviews.Content: I feel like writing a review because of the negative things I have read here. I stayed at this hotel for about three weeks and enjoyed my stay at the room. Stayed at the smallest room, which is what it is..small, but not "drama drama" small, enough room for one or two people. If a big room is what you need, then you need to look elsewhere..the small room is quite cousy, with a nice supercomfy bed, which is what matters most at a hotel. Location is fine too, it's right inbetween everything in central Singapore, so everywhere you want to go is just a busride away. MRT is a 5-10 minute walk, even in hot humid weather that's close enough (though many people seem scared of walking a few minutes these days?). Hot weather and humidity didn't stop us from walking to Clarke quay or Chinatown regularly either. So yeah, a good stay, and will go again someday.

Reviews.Title: “You can find much better with lower price in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: maxolino76
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extremely small and bathroom very bad. Concierge people tried all the time to drive you to "suggested" shopping centres/shops 100% bad. Position is terrible and few taxi stay at the hotel (extra charge to get to the Hotel). Walking is very dangerous. Breakfast not included but restaurant looks very poor and food very cheap. Not reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, a great night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Shoppajen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ex University student accommodation and as such the standard rooms are very compact. Not too small though, as everything fits in nicely and has been decided with both style and practicality in mind. A large, comfortable king size bed and quiet surroundings ensured an excellent night's sleep. Breakfast in the morning is a buffet affair with a number of choices, good enough to set you up for the day. Location is VERY good. I'm not sure what the other negative comments are relating to really - the MRT (underground) is 5 mins walk away down two short flights of steps and a meandering slight hill and the lovely iced drinks that can be bought in Outram MRT station from the cake shop are a good reward for the short journey. Hotel Re also runs a free shuttle into town, so you can't really go wrong. China Town is a short walk or one stop on the MRT, and it is equally easy to get to Sentosa, Orchard Row, Little India - you name it. Our shower was slightly broken when we arrived, but 10 mins after our phone call to reception the maintenance man turned up and fixed it immediately. A nice little hotel that is somewhat cheaper than the big names.

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and cheerful hotel”
Reviews.Author: au_syd_traveller
Reviews.Content: Booked myself into this hotel for two nights stop over as part of my trip to Asia and Europe. Hotel is located at the top of the hill at Outram Park - it is a good 10 mins walk to the nearest MRT station. With Singapore humidity and temperature at mid 30c, 10 mins walk under the sun is rather challenging. Check-in was swift, got a room facing the hill. Room was absolutely tiny - has 2 single beds, a desk with a LCD TV hung onto the wall. Bathroom was tiny but clean. They even give you toothbrush but it is very much a single use disposable type. The theme of the hotel and room is very 70s retro - pictures are reflective of the hotel and room. The room is so tiny that you can hardly fit two large suitcases in. Luckily I was on my own and have minimal luggage. Breakfast was included in my room booking - food at the restaurant was average. For the two days that I had stayed there, they served identical buffet breakfast. It fills you up if you put quality aside. Overall, I rate this as a cheap and cheerful hotel. Hotels at Singapore are very expensive so it is very much what you pay is what you get. Would I come back to this hotel? Probably not - location is a bit out of the way. 10mins walk is too much for me at 35c and 90% humidity. Will I recommend this hotel to anyone? Yes, this is good value for someone with tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay but Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: armchannel
Reviews.Content: Well like all review about this hotel, it will take you about 5-10mins walk up a hill from Outram Park MRT station. It's actually closer than what you think. As for the room, very small but you pay what you get and the bed was comfortable and the air condition were cold. We stay here for 2 nights and were offer breakfast at an additional price during check in. However, the rate were different during check out but they are very nice enough to offer us the previous rate. In addition to that the night staff had provided excellent service as a taxi cap took me to a different place and tried to charge me extra and the hotel staff came to the rescue. However, it took them about 10 minutes to find my jacket as I left it at the room after check out. Overall it's a good place to stay for a retreat as there really isn't anything near by.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Rooms and Decor but a bit of a walk from MRT”
Reviews.Author: Leighnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a vacation. The rates are cheaper as compared to the other hotels in the city center. We just had a problem with a package left for us in the hotel. It took them 10 minutes before they can find it because they did not properly logged it. The rooms are small but it was okay with what we paid for. It was clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. They did not have a lot of cable channels, only HBO. The only disadvantage with this hotel was that it was quite a walk from the hotel to the Outram Park MRT station. The back door also closes at midnight so you have to hurry if you want to pass through it if you stayed out late at night. There are also no convenience stores nearby so you also need to walk a bit just to see a store. Another thing was that the walls are thin that you can hear other people passing by your room. This hotel is only recommended for young couples. Children and senior citizens will have a bit of a hard time with the walk from the hotel to the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Just good!”
Reviews.Author: Alicenov
Reviews.Content: Knowing that almost every hotel in Singapore often have good occupancy, so they don't care much wether guest return to stay their hotel again. That's my second time staying at this hotel and there was no impression upon check-in . I requested triple room , but the first day I found the amenities set up for 2 persons and I informed to receptionist before I went out . She agreed to add one more set but when I returned back at the late evening , I found nothing additional. Till, I called for reception again , then I got an additional one. It seemed that there was only acknowledgement without passing the message to their team. The wall in my room was torn and a bit dirty , we just saw in the night before we check-out. The sofa in front of counter was torn and dirty as well. Besides these negative points, we found that Cambodian staffs over there are very friendly & helpful , they could provide more information that we wanted. There is shuttle bus every morning which is convenient to go MRT station .

Reviews.Title: “No different from $60 bucks at Happy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicbizz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in June 2010 for USD 100 per night. The good: Not much really. Cheap, but Copthorne King's down the road at the same price and way better. The bad: rooms sure looks way glitzier on the website! That's what convinced us to give it a shop. Turn out they're tiny, aesthetically crass, and our bathroom door's broken. No curtains, only blinds, just like my college dorm! Place reminds me of Happy Hotel in Geyland. The Ugly: close to town, but this hotel is located on a hill - you have to call for a cab. For some place as connected as Singapore, this is a big negative. Shuttle service, but inconsistent. Conclusion: only thing going for it is price, but you can find much better in around the same range. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: duellema
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't in a bad location, but you will definitely need a cab to get there. There is a shuttle that runs into the city from the hotel, but they do not pick up after 8pm and you have to know where to get it. Don't be dazzled by the seemingly modern details. The rooms are indeed tiny and some of them don't even have windows. Things are kitschy and basic. The hotel isn't awful, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Seeker707
Reviews.Content: HEED ALL THE WARNINGS! We didn’t. Unfortunately, we decided to ignore the bad reviews on here and give the Hotel Re a try. It looked really cool and was close to China Town and a metro stop that would get us into the center of town quickly. That’s all well and good, but the actually hotel was a DISASTER. The staff was extremely rude and unaccommodating. And they lie. We didn’t have a reservation and decided to just show up (because there were vacancies online). When we got there, they told us everything was booked. Then they said they would call a hotel down the street to see if there was anything there. Um, right. The girl picked up the phone and didn’t even hit any numbers. She replaced the receiver about 30 seconds later and told us the other hotel was booked too. (Was there some sort of recording to tell her that right when she picked up the phone??) Then, as we got to the door to leave and find another place, a room magically opened up for us! Wasn’t that convenient. We were told we could have that room for one night and then we would have to change rooms (fine). When we went down the next morning, the woman at the front desk told us we could just stay in that room but for the third night we would have to change rooms. Ok, fine. Well we went down the next morning and there were only the most expensive rooms left and the young man at the front desk, Benjamin (not his real name, I’m sure), told us we had to take the room which was more than double the price we were currently paying. (The woman the day before had told us this wouldn’t happen.) When I asked for a manager, Benjamin LAUGHED at me. I’m sorry, I asked him, is it funny that I would like to speak to a manager? When the manager came, I had to argue with him for 50 minutes until we finally agreed to what we had been promised the morning before. In the midst of the argument, he told me they had no other rooms (sorry kiddo, we heard that lie the first night we were there). We should have left the minute the first lie was told. On top of that, toiletries were not replaced every morning as promised. There weren’t the right number of towels. I have stayed at MANY hotels and hostels during my travels and this was by far the WORST, MOST FRUSTRATING experience and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone. Maybe my worst enemy, but that’s being generous.

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arcline_ds
Reviews.Content: The Stay at hotel Re, was for a city Break with My Mother and Wife which we spent 5 days in singapore. The Triple room that we got was a bearly enough for single person and the third bed was kept in a niche where I had to crawl to get on to the bed. Just check the Photographs published arn't they Graphically inproved ( Photoshop) Images. The real thing does not follow most of the images. Quite far to most of the activities and should take a taxi The staff was quite friendly, However I consider this as my worst hotel experiance I ever had, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ReTRO!!!!! 2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier_Dr
Reviews.Content: Nice, trendy, retro hotel. Lives up to it's name. Tastefully decorated and gives you that 70's feel with a touch of modern living. Reasonably priced, and within walking distance to a MRT station (can't remember the station name though). Also, there's a great park just in front of it too for those who have a habit of taking morning walks. Taxi to Orchard Road is around SGD 5.00, which of course translates to its good location.....possible to walk to Clarke Quay too.... Overall, had a nice stay there. Will come back if have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice!”
Reviews.Author: sneeky_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three day stop over. They checked us in an hour or so early without to much of a hassle. The staff was quite helpful and friendly. They even arranged to take us to Clarke Quay with the shuttle bus that is suppose to go the MRT. I read some previous reviews saying it is far from the MRT, but the MRT is just about 7 minutes walk through the park. The hotel is a bit out of the way, but is still 15 minutes to all the tourist areas. This hotel is not GREAT, but it is nice for a short stopover. I’ll definitely return if I go to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ccci
Reviews.Content: Our experience can be summed as 'simple, fuss free, clean and comfortable'. Contrary to what some of the earlier viewers said, the staff here were very friendly and helpful, the wifi speed was superb, and breakfast was simple but nice. We have the complimentary head and neck message and the messeur was real good. Although the location is a bit distance from shops and restaurants, they hace the shuttle bus service which will solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bad idea.”
Reviews.Author: whitemartinii
Reviews.Content: Perhaps reviews are still alright because of the low rates and many promotions that come with the hotel packages. I booked a rejuvenate package that comes with a 60 min massage for my spouse's birthday celebration. The exterior of the hotel was gaudy, had mismatching lights greeting us before we stepped into the hotel lobby. The duty manager didn't know his stuff well and had to keep asking his colleague that caused both of us standing there for so long. We wanted to book the massage time and he told us that we didn't have to book because there will be available masseurs when we walk in to the massage place. So we didn't. Plus he didn't know how to swipe my card as well. Had dinner at the hotel, though we had 30% off food menu and 1-for-1 drinks all night, the food was terrible. Staff was polite but kept forgetting our stuff like utensils, plates etc. Oh but the only good thing was that they upgraded our room to the suite or 2nd biggest room due to available rooms. Room was alright, kinda small but has a bathtub. Gave us l'occitane shower gel and shampoo and bath salts too. Bed was comfy! The next morning we woke up in the morning to book our massage for 2pm, and the duty manager said it was fully booked till 6pm. We related what the previous duty manager told us, that we didn't have to book, so why could it have been fully booked? He was nonchalent and replied: I can't help you, Its really fully booked. What can I do? Was obviously shocked to hear that, and after explaining the situation to him for a longer time, he said he'll call us back. We waited for about 15-20 minutes, before we called him back. The first time he didn't pick up, the second time he picked up and said: Yah you want to ask regarding your massage thing right, it's fully booked I told you. Why did he needed to 'call me back' and tell me the same thing??? Which he didn't call as promised too! He told me to go back another day and said he couldn't do anything about it. Another staff took over and finally came up with a solution to extend our stay till 6pm so we could enjoy the massage at 6pm. Massage wasn't 60 mins, it was about 45-50 minutes. Masseurs seemed to be in a rush, they just applied pressure on my body, didn't seem too professional, think I could do this myself. We agreed we'll never go back to hotel Re anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Convenient Money's Worth”
Reviews.Author: Carrie-ee
Reviews.Content: 7 of us in the family decided to visit Singapore in the recent Lunar New Year holidays. So we booked Hotel Re with the recommendation of my best friend and after reviewing Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is nice cozy and comfortable, very trendy and nice, unlike the conventional type of hotels. The standard room is small, but it’s comfortable for 2 pax per room. The room is very trendy and clean. We enjoy our stay very much! The hotel provides shuttle service to few places like the Outram MRT Station, Paragon and Clarke Quay. So, it’s very convenient. It is only 15 minutes by cab from the hotel to Sentosa Resorts World. The only disadvantage is the first walk from the Outram MRT station to the hotel under very hot weather. It is quite a distance. Upon arrival at the hotel, we do not have to worry about walking to the MRT station anymore as they’ve shuttle services or we just took cab as it’s cheap and convenient too. We truly enjoy our stay at Re! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: ShantiGohil
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night saty as we were flying out next day to Vietnam,We took the MRT from Changi airport less than 2SGD$.Got off Outram Park andgo left and cross the main road,take the first right turn, walked around the park(one can walk in the park) and follow signs and turned right into a small sideroad and climbed some steps and through a gate(back entrance) and straight into reception.During the day there is a shuttle to and fro Outram Park MRT.I know the walk to the hotel was a bit out of ordinary in the sense that i had to climb some steps.But it was all forgiven when i reached the reception.We were greeted well and professionally,checked in very quickly,the room we were in was very tastefully done,very retro 70s style,alittle pckey but beautifully done and all one wants from a nights stay.Bathroom was excellent again everything was provided.Most of all it was very reasonably priced in comparision to other hotels in SIN.Chinatown is walking distance apssed thr MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from MRT station and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Sophdobe
Reviews.Content: I arrive Singapore pretty late and by the time I got to the hotel, it was almost midnight, so their free shuttle bus was no longer avaliabel. The hotel is a bit of a walk from MRT station and you have to walk through a park - which can be scary at night. (Taxi cost $SG5 to get to Outram Park MRT station cuz we couldn't be bothered to walk the next day). The front desk lady can be a bit rude as she kept saying "what? what? what?" I don't understand - May be she really couldn't understand, but the way she said it made her sound really impatient and it's not just to me - I heard her on the phone to many other guests and she said the same thing. The room is nice on their own though and the flat screen tv is big with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “noisy renovations, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: Breizho
Reviews.Content: The renovation being done at this hotel makes things quite noisy. The hotel ignored my requests when I reserved for a double bed and high floor, they told me this was just a request and they weren't obliged to provide me with this. They really didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden cost, paper thin wall...the funky interior to cover up most basic services”
Reviews.Author: demona_pastime
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience stayed at a so called Boutique Hotel. I stayed there for 3 weeks at the deluxe room. No concierge that escort you to the room, I have to drag my bag. The room is definitely very very small... especially in the bathroom and the shower area, cannot imagine people with big posture navigate this place. Must admit the interior is really funky, get you the fun atmosphere... the bed is definitely very comfortable to sleep on. They have wi-fi but very slow, can't even play Youtube. The flat screen is too big, so it gets really uncomfortable to watch when you sitting down. There is no L'Ocitane toiletteries that been brag about on their website and brochure. The electricity went out 2-3 times, first time I experience this in Singapore. Most annoying is the paper thing wall, I called up several time to the receptionist, because the room next door is full of teenager playing games @ midnight. I can heard any body walking on the aisle and the TV noise from room next door. And calling for service is a drag, its never answer immediately, because the called goes back to receptionist....sometime I have to called again because my request has not been send. They say it close to MRT...well ...consider you enjoy walking a lot in Singapore ....yes it is close, however we have to walk across the park, so when it raining, that would be impossible unless you have rain coat and umbrella, I don't thing traveler always carry those stuff with them. Its located on a hill so when you walking to the hotel is incline, good for cardio work out. What dissapoint me most is the hidden cost that they called housekeeping charge every time I asked for sugar or tea or asked them to check the room electricity, and it because they never refill the sugar in the room. Small value like $2-3, but annoying. Not much tasting the food, only come down for breakfast 2 times, the most horrible taste of coffee in Sin. This is very disappointing, since Singaporean like their coffee, a simple favorite drinks suppose to be good. I would not recommend people to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Retro and Alternative”
Reviews.Author: Chozz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Re! for 4 nights and fully enjoyed our time. It is unlike any other hotel i have ever stayed in. The 70s style stencil images on the walls of the rooms and lift, along with the interior design made it a more interesting place to stay then a typical city hotel. Staff were helpful - particularly the concierge who was kind enough to let me into the terrace bar at 4am to watch a football match (the one where henry handled the ball!). The rooms could have been bigger, but they were very quiet which is always great. Wi-fi available too. Its location is a little bit far out - but its only a few mins walk to the metro station - and you can walk to chinatown easily from the hotel too. They also run a shuttle bus if you're really lazy.

Reviews.Title: “A rainbow after the stormy rain”
Reviews.Author: Lolita_0526
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I was astounded by the recovery service from the management of Hotel Re! It was something that left us quite an impression on this hotel itself as well as the staffs there. We checked into Hotel Re! on the 1st Jan 2010 with a great promotion price and we decided to upgrade the room from standard to an executive for only an additional SGD20++. The check - in was efficient. We were definitely impressed by the whole outlook of the room. Once we entered the room, we were greeted by the sweet, fruity aroma. It was clean, cozy and quite a good size. One of the reason why we chose Hotel Re!, is because of its unique theme; Retro with a hint of modern. The toiletries were amazing and they have a good size of bathtub as well. All in all, we definitely love the room. We dined in at Re!Fresh for dinner that night. A well description of: great tasting food at a very reasonable price. A plate of Carbonara makes me wanting more as the base is not too heavy and of course, it was delicious. We will come back there just to dine in Re!Fresh. Here’s where the problem rise; during check out. Upon signing the receipt, we realized that we were overcharged. We were charged for wine which we never ordered. We explained to them that we were already in our room by the time the receipt is printed. The manager on duty, named Daniel let us check out with the void order of wine. We then received a call from him again, and this time he said that we did ordered the bottle of wine. My partner asked him to check again on this matter as we did not even purchase any wine, be it as a room service or dine in. We were frustrated by the false accusation. We waited for them to get back to us on the matter and we received the call the following day. This time, we received an apology call from Daniel. He truly apologized on the accusation and explained to us with details on what happened. They managed to track the CCTV system and it was not us who stepped out from Re!Wine. Hence, it was a genuine mistake and they have taken a necessary action on it. One of the guests poked our room number by mistake; I really hope it wasn’t intentionally. Despite this occurrence, we were satisfied by the recovery service and since it was an honest mistake we decided to let it by. It was not a bad experience at Re!, however we really felt that we had quite a great stay there. A special thanks to Mr. Daniel and Mr. Anash who have helped us out with this very difficult situation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: wilystoat
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for one night by the excellent Singapore Airlines when they changed my flight. Frankly I knew I wouldn't like this hotel, it's not the kind of place I'd ever choose, and I'm a little surprised that Singapore Airlines use it. The hotel is actually a converted school, and it feels like it! The location is not great. I like walking, but when I ventured out of the hotel it seemed to be in the middle of nowhere, and in the heat, knowing I was there for just one night, I just couldn't be bothered to start walking looking for signs of civilisation. Surprisingly the restaurant closes early so as a stopover hotel it's not too convenient. However the staff were friendly and this made my unscheduled stay far less painful than it could have been. To summarise, it's a very basic hotel converted from a former school building, with a very tacky pop music theme ???!! mediocre rooms, a rather average restaurant that closes early, and it's in the middle of nowhere so you'll need taxis. One more thing (and I'll never understand why any hotel would allow this)..the shower head didn't even fit in its holder which meant you had to hold the shower with one hand. Any hotel must meet a few basic requirements..bathing, sleeping, eating, so it amazes me that that any hotel that caters to tired international travellers could have a shower that doesn't function properly!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: bilkeys
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Singapore are quite pricey for what you get, but at Hotel Re, i found it compared well to others I have stayed at. We were checked in promptly by efficient staff. We had a twin superior room which was very small, but it had everything we needed. The room was very funky and bright. The bathroom was very clean and the TV was great too. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel, so that made things a bit hard in the morning as the hotel is not really located in a convenient place. We used their shuttle bus quite often which was great. You could walk to the MRT but we opted for the easy option. Cabs around Singapore are not too expensive and we paid about $20 to the hotel from the airport. One thing to note are the fantastic massages offered in their small spa. I would recommend Hotel Re for singles or couples. It would be quite a boring place if you had kids or liked spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, pics are deceiving. Extremely disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Zionsingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a theme suite, the room terribly small to be called a suite, receptionist was quite rude and unhelpful. For over SGD$600++ a night, it's totally not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Retro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dayzee_darl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 4th December 2009. Unfortunately my flight had been severely delayed from Melbourne so instead of arriving at approx 9.30pm on 3rd December I did not actually get to check in until 6.40am the next day and as I was due to check out at noon I was quite worried until the lovely guy at reception assured me he would try his best to accommodate me with a late checkout. On arrival at my room I was pleased to find it very clean and tidy and it was slightly larger that I had been led to believe from reading some of the previous reviews. After it was confirmed that I could have a check out at 7pm I settled down for a good sleep and on wakening I found a couple of hours to spare before departing so I visited the Re Wine Bar where I was warmly greeted by Charlie the bartender who ushered me to a seat on the balcony before bringing me a deliciously cold Tiger beer and complimentary bowl of nuts. It seemed so surreal relaxing in the balmy weather listening to old Bing Crosby and Ella Fitzgerald songs!! I found every member of staff I encountered to be extremely helpful and the next time I am in Singapore I will definitely stay at this quirky hotel again....I mean.....after all how many hotel can boast a glass lift with a lifesize Marilyn Monroe on the window?? Of the three hotels I have visited whilst in Singapore Hotel Re is my favourite (the other 2 being The Allson and Peninsular). On my next visit I will ensure that I stay at least 3 days so that I can explore the hotel's facilities better and make use of the regular complmentary bus service into downtown Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy, baby”
Reviews.Author: RBM056
Reviews.Content: Er, yes - this is a one-time primary school now converted into a fine hotel trying - not too hard - to bring a touch of 60s grooviness to staid old Singapore. And it works - cheerful colours, functional and well designed rooms. Slightly baffling automation to a child of the 60s such as myself - I've never had to use the room card to operate the lift before, though on reflection it's a good idea. An invigorating (?) 10-minute walk over Pearl's Hill brings you to Chinatown, now glossily sanitized with an abundance of retail outlets and themed restaurants. Also the Chinatown Heritage Centre, which is well worth a visit and very moving. Walk round the hill and you get to an MRT (Mass Rapid Transportation) station with fast access to all of Singapore. There is a regular hotel shuttle mornings and afternoons to the MRT and central Singapore. Service was cool and efficient. The small restaurant was closed when we arrived at 10:30 pm, but they sent out for a takeaway for us, and this being Singapore, the peppered prawns when they arrived were the best I've ever eaten. Only gripe: internet connections were agonisingly slow. Pages I had visited without delay in Thailand and Malaysia took 3-4 minutes to display. I could hazard a guess as to why this was so, but I won't.

Reviews.Title: “compact but cool”
Reviews.Author: bandbcyprus
Reviews.Content: nice hotel on edge of the park opposite chinatown we made good use of the free bus which went to all the main locations as you would prob need a taxi back unless ypu walk uphill from the main station about 10 mins away. value for money

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: krishcold
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on 2 seperate occasions...a week apart... the hotel is right next to chinatown and the hotel offers free shuttle service to chinatown, outram and orchard mrt stations... staff very courteous... the rooms are way too small...we stayed in the executive and regular rooms....both have small rooms...just that the bathroom is bigger in the executive room.. we were out shopping and sightseeing most of the time and we found it a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: gemmit
Reviews.Content: great location near china town ,,close to mrt .modern hotel clean and friendly. Rooms are small but the beds are excellent , room amenities and bath room toiletries very good quality . Only thing in room i didnt like was the extra small bar fridge ..colourfull interior gives a great happy impression ,staff are very helpfull as is the resturant staff .(food is average )

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: UkRach_Paul
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but they're clean, nice and modern. Staff are very helpful and friendly. We got upgraded so no complaints from us! Very close the metro stop and easy to find. Only negatives are the restaurant and bar are a let down - terrible food, tiny bar - and it's a bit of a trek to find anywhere close for a quick bite to eat or drink. They seem to market themselves as a boutique hotel - it's not, it's just a fairly large hotel with some quirky decor - not that there's anthing wrong with that, just don't go expecting boutique quality or service.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, but nice”
Reviews.Author: iskoolboy
Reviews.Content: Looking at the hotel photos, one immediately gets the sense that this is a quirky hotel, but it's nice. The rooms are ok, although the one we got had a leak that made the bathroom floor constantly wet. The concierge was knowledgable and quite helpful. This hotel is good value. Our one wish is that they'd provide free internet, rather than charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re is just as funky as the the pictures on their web site suggests. OK, the rooms are smallish but clean and well kept. The previous guest in our room had been smoking quite heavily but this was remedied with an ionizer. The staff was very friendly eager to help our stay enjoyable. Hotel Re's only problem is in my view the location. It is a bit out of the way and you need to do some walking or get on the subway to get to restaurants or shopping areas. The breakfast buffet was a bit uninspired so I would recommend going out some some local food court or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Kellylp
Reviews.Content: This place is very retro and quirky. Staff were helpful and friendly and they operate a free shuttle bus during parts of the day. The hotel is not located in the perfect spot as it a good 10 min walk through the park to Chinatown MRT station (not a problem for us as we dont mind a walk, but something to bear in mind). Rooms are quite small - not sure if this is a general Singapore thing(?). We opted for breakfast, but it wasnt that fantastic if I'm honest - certainly not bad enough for me to deter anyone from staying there though, as our stay was very enjoyable, the rooms funky and clean, lovely staff and a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & funky, with all you need but without the luxury feel”
Reviews.Author: Lippy18
Reviews.Content: This is fun looking hotel, very funkily decorated with a different theme for each floor. Our room had everything we expected of a quality hotel but there was just a feel of it being ever so slightly cheap. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and functional, there was a TV and a large window let in plenty of natural light. The room was an average size and it's difficult to say anything bad about it but also nothing too exceptional either apart from the funky decor, which was PINK with Marilyn Monroe silhouette's above the bed, and small, sparkly pink and pale green tiles in the bathroom.
