Location wise Hotel Re! is a little way from being bang in the middle of everything but there is Metro station about a 5 minute walk away across a small park, so it's easy enough to get around and although we didn't try it, I don't think it's too far to walk to Chinatown or Clarke Quay. For value and cheeriness this hotel is definitely recommendable if the larger hotels of Singapore are outside your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: GarethDouglas1979
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Re to be told they wouldn't be able to accomodate our booking of a double room and we would have a twin room. This was the last couple of days of our honeymoon and we'd booked this hotel (due to great reviews on this site) over five months previously. After arguing that we'd booked a double room and when we said we'd go somewhere else they miraculously found us a double. Very strange indeed. It then however took another 30mins to get the key for this room and into it. This was all incredibly frustrating. Upon arrival at the room we discovered that it could well be the smallest room we have ever stayed in. It was clean enough but beware the pictures on the website must have been taken with an incredibly wide-angled lens!! The location of the hotel is not bad to be fair as it's near to a MRT stop. Although strangely they shut the quickest route to the MRT after midnight so if you return after this time you have to go the long way! All in all this wasn't a great experience and I'd pay twice as much to go elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: gailmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this quirkily decorated hotel for 3 nights on our way back to Australia from Italy & Egypt. If you like bright pink & lime green then this hotel is for you. The staff is very helpful & the rooms spacious & very clean. The bathroom toiletries are great - they even provide toothbrush & toothpaste. The bed was huge & very comfortable & each room has a wide screen digital TV. There is a restaurant on site which serves a good variety of delicious meals, both western & chinese (try the fried beef kweoy tay). Breakfast is largely chinese based so may not appeal to western palates but the chef will cook you any style of eggs on the spot & there is the usual cereal, yoghurt, fruit & toast so you won't go hungry but it is a bit pricey at S18 & there is no other choice. However, you can find every conceivable type of food at Orchard Rd if you don't want to eat at the hotel. Internet is available but it is not free. However, there are tea/coffee making facilities in the room which was a bonus after Italy & Egypt where there were no such facilities. The concierge was a lovely man who went out of his way for us. If we ever return to Singapore, we will return to Re! Pearl's Hill.

Reviews.Title: “room is too small”
Reviews.Author: rubytaiwan
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and a 5 year old son and the hotel gave us a 3 bed room but the position of the bed is soooo weird. one of the bed is located in small place separated with the other 2 beds. the bath room is also sooo small and the tile is kinda slippery. the air con is installed right in front of the bed so you can feel blowing wind direct to your head. we actually booked for 3 nights but we cancelled and move furama which is better located and we got upgraded room from them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far”
Reviews.Author: GLENGCRUZ
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel Re last Sep 12-14, 2009. When we arrive in Hotel Re,we didn't realized at first how far we are from Orchard Road. Until we went down for a walk after a 2-3 hours rest . Good points are, hotel is clean. The bed is very conducive for sleeping. I love their bed, pillows and bedsheet!I rally had a nice sleep here! Staffs are friendly, upon request they allowed us for early check-in and late check-out of up to 2pm.Breakfast is ok, although not much choices, especially on the 2nd day when they removed the fried rice which we are looking.they changed it to noodles instead...Nice staff also.some are Filipina.. Hotel Re is also very near China Town. Which is the best place to buy all your pasalubong./souvenirs. Another Positive point about this hotel is free wifi and free call anywhere in Singapore be it landline or mobile phone...Negative points are: This is very far from Orchard Road. Next time, I would want to stay at a hotel near Orchard Road because 1, to be able to find restaurants and places to eat to which are just walking distance to your hotel! I am sure you would mind paying SGD10 /per way everytime you want to eat or go for a mall shopping. Although my agent told me Hotel Re has free shuttle going to Orchard Rd, they have 2 schedules only. 11am and 2:30 pm...so if you want to go shopping as early as 10am, you will still need to wait for the 11am shuttle. or if you miss the 11am, worst you have to wait for the 2:30pm free shuttle..which is such a waste of time.2, the hotel is located in Pearl'sHill. Although near China Town where you can eat, and eat cheap foods, by the time you want to go back to your hotel, you still need to walk up going to your hotel.by the time you reach Hotel Re, you are hungry again and tired! For those who wants to just take a rest and spend some quiet time in Singapore, this is the best hotel. But for those persons who wants to shop, eat and have fun walking around...I suggest choose a hotel near Orchard Road..Hotel Re is nice but not extra ordinarily nice, meals niether..so 3 star hotel along Orchard Road would be much much better..considering how expensive taxi is in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a retro feel”
Reviews.Author: Russ1470
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not from your bog standard faceless chain of hotels. Each floor has a different theme. We were staying on the 'Bruce Lee' floor. The room we stayed in was small but perfectly formed. The bathroom with its sparkly gold tiles was well fitted out. The hotel has a shuttle bus which runs a limited drop off and pick up service around to the main sites of Singapore. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from China Town and a twenty minute walk from the waterside. I would stay here again if visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location...”
Reviews.Author: enginersoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Hotel Re and we loved this Hotel. Except rooms are little bit small, rooms are clean have a good furniture and equipment. Hotel is very close to MRT station and Chinatown. Wi-Fi is free and free shuttle is available to MRT and important points of city.We recommend this hotel to everybody that looking for good and good value hotel.Hotel is in a park and very night is very silence.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Located about 10min walk from Chinatown, Singapore - Fun funky hotel, neat rooms - Free internet - Nice hotel facilities - Great staff - Well priced - Close to two MRT lines (purple and green) Cons- - That ten minute walk is going to make you sweat (very hilly and uncomfortable). - If you don't like the Chinatown area, not a great place to walk around. - Rooms kind of small. Singapore is notoriously difficult to find a good hotel deal in. I would suggest this hotel for a few days and then pick another hotel to move to (get a different side of Singapore).

Reviews.Title: “Funky and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dennistravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Re! for a four hour stopover during our trip from Canada to Thailand. The hotel was arranged through Singapore Airlines which included transport to and from the airport. Although we didn’t get to stay too long and didn’t explore the neighbourhood due to our stay being in the early morning hours, the Hotel Re! is a pretty cool boutique hotel. Our particular room had silhouettes of Marilyn Monroe on the walls with hot pink paint, hot pink shelves and the bathroom...the tiles in the bathroom were different shades of pink sparkles – I loved it so much and it has inspired me for future bathroom renovations. The amenities in the room were high quality – Shampoo, Conditioner and body wash from L’Occitane. The room was small so if you are spending a decent time in Singapore you may want something larger – however, it is our guess that Singapore hotels may be similar to those found in London – small on space and high on price. Our room had two single beds, a television, mini fridge, tea kettle and the bathroom which was a shower only, no bathtub. Singapore looks like a lovely city and it has become a destination at the top of our travel ‘to do’ list.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: mazzy79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Singapore for a quick weekend break. I have a preference for boutique hotels so decided to try Hotel Re. Cab drivers are still not familiar with the hotel location although the hotel's been up for more than a year I think. The walk from the Outram MRT to Re takes about 8-10 mins, but is a pleasant walk if you're not in a hurry (not exactly a luggage-friendly route!) We had a Deluxe room; well-designed room with limited space. Small but feels cozy, so its ok. I liked the bright pink disco motif, L'Occitane toiletries and its nice 37" inch LCD TV in the room - great value for the room! Wish they had a luggage rack. Cafe food was just average, and we always called for a cab (due to its location on a small hill). Other than that, friendly and helpful staff - Ms Suhaila at Front Desk was very efficient and informative. I will try the next bigger room when I return to Re.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: IanGBradford
Reviews.Content: Very good place to use as a base for a break in Singapore. Close to metro station (5 min walk ) and close to Chinatown (15 min walk). Staff friendly and effficient. Rooms may be a little quirky for some (80s retro), but very well equiped and maintained. We had a late flight (midnight), but staff allowed us to stay in our room until 3pm, and then gave us access to a room to let us shower. An excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: churachura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Re hotel for singapore airline stop over scheme which was only 2 us dollers. Hotel was located near china town. If you walk from the closest underground, it will take 15 mins up the hill. but it was ok. there are free bus service from the hotel but it is not so frequent. the room was small, but very clean and stylish. amenities were l'occitane. the breakfast was quite pricey, so we went to china town for chinese breakfast which was really cheal and met lots of locals.

Reviews.Title: “Really great - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: shibbly
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re We found this hotel to be very good - just what we wanted and good for the price. The staff were excellent – so friendly and helpful. We got an upgrade – room was very nice, clean and funky décor. The location is not too central however the nearest metro station is five min walk away and the trains run very frequently. There is also a free shuttle bus run by the hotel which goes to all the good parts of town. The food at the restaurant was also good. We highly recommend this hotel, particularly for younger people. On a different note – for all visitors to Singapore – fantastic place but don’t be fooled by rickshaw drivers – they will take you for a ride (and not the good type) and take a lot of your money and risk your life in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot, got much much more”
Reviews.Author: tutlek
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Singapore and Kuala Lumpur with my wife on a honeymoon. Singapore was our base and we spent there 9 out of 13 nights in south-east Asia. I looked for affordable hotel with good reviews and after checking around I found hotel Re! I liked its design and price so I went for it. I expected to get a good hotel and service, but everything about Re surprised me in a good way. The staff are friendly and they always went extra mile to accommodate us. First we checked in and I asked for a good room because our honeymoon (we reserved basic double room) and they instantly upgraded us from superior to deluxe room on the top floor with great view over Ortram park and Singapore skyline. The room itself was great – not very big but sufficient enough. L'Octaine amenities refreshed every day, two complimentary bottles of water every day, free fast wi-fi Internet etc. Great design, great bathroom… For me it was really exceptional. After first week we checked out and we left 3 out of our 4 suitcases in the Hotel to wait for us. We went to Kuala Lumpur for 4 nights. After we came back we checked in again, and this time I didn't even say that we were on our honeymoon. We were set down for a few minutes untill they could find a room for us as they were full.- After three or four minutes one of the staff came up to us and told us that he saw that we are on our honeymoon and that they are upgrading us to the Business Room on the top floor – this is three grades above what we reserved!! This was totally unexpected and I'm still grateful for this  Oh yeah – the rooms and the hotel itself are very very clean. Now for some useful tips: Location – I saw that some people think that location is not really good and I have to disagree. I landed at Changi around 11am and I was in the hotel maybe one hour after landing (take in account custom control etc.). Outram park station is on the MRT line which starts at Changi Airport and it took us around 30min with that line from Changi to Outram Park Station. When we exited the station we went on the „back“ exit and we saw the big sign „Re! Hotel“ there showing us the way. It took us maybe 5-10min walk to get to the hotel (with luggage). It is very close to Chinatown so there is definitely no need to take MRT to go to Chinatown, just walk for 5 minutes from OP station and you will be there. Connectivity - I think that this is a good location as Outram park Station has two main lines that operate on it – „East-West“ and „North-East“. First one will take you in a matter of minutes to some crucial spots in Singapore like Bugis, Raffles Place, City Hall etc. And with North-East line you have only one stop to Harbourfront and Santosa express and on other side you can access Orchard road if you go to Dhoby Ghaut station – that is basically east end of Orchard road. Shuttle Service – Re has a good shuttle service if you don't like taking MRT and it's free. It starts from Re every hour on the top of the hour and it can take you to: Outram Park station, Clark Quay, Orchard Road etc. Great service even if you use it only to get to MRT OP station To conclude – I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It's quiet, peaceful and I felt lika I'm home there in every sense of the word. Staff was friendly, intimate. In KL I stayed in Sheraton in much much bigger room and everything else that comes with 5* hotel, but I couldn't wait to get back to Re, and I'm sure that this will be my hotel of choice whenever I go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Singapore stop. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: janu007
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day stop in Singapore and felt that Hotel Re was excellent value. We paid $70 per night (Agoda deal) and were happy with our choice. The decor was fun and the rooms were spotless. The beds were SO comfortable and the L'Occitane bath products were a treat. In terms of location, if you don't want to wait for the bus, it is about a $4 taxi to Clarke's Quay and there is also a hotel shuttle that is free and runs every hour to popular spots in the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff-great manager”
Reviews.Author: Davidcsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in february and was delighted but this time(August), we nearly regret it. We booked like a month ago, and on check in got only single bed instead of queen one; apparently only given on availability. The good thing is that eventhough it was was early, we got out room. .... A super tiny room, i think the 712 was the left over space but still need to fit in a room to maximise the hotel. The shower cubicle had curtain instead of door, just give you the impression of the those really really cheap hotel on the street, the shower head holder was broken and fixed by amateur with a rusty screw, but still not holding the shower head at all(they fixed it properly when complained tho), the curtain was useless. A huge lack of ammenities and since we stayed there before, we asked for them and the obvious reply, we do not provide this,(not sure if that was the training buzz word) to get rid of you. The next day, we took the shuttle bus to orchard road, took us 55 mins to get there, a trip worth 20-30 mins. The driver has decided to please one of the customer who was leaving by going all the way to bugis just for them. So we had to rush to get something to eat off orchard and took a taxi to get to my medical appointment. The best was 4am in the morning, bang bang, our door just broke opened and new client getting in our room, the security lock broke until my gf shouted. 5 mins later when trying to get back to sleep, the receptionist to appology. Anyway.... next day, talked to the manager, she really catch up, good service recovery. Upgraded us to business room, with a fruit basket and even on check out she proposed for late check out. But her staff really need re-training.... they su.....ed.... they mistakenly AGAIN charged us the business room but the manager rectified. So guess Hotel Re... it a think twice for next time. FRom loving it, hating it, to maybe, maybe not

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to remember”
Reviews.Author: GiannisAthens
Reviews.Content: Although Re! looks very pop at first sight, the reality is that it does not have anything to offer to the Singapore visitor. Small rooms -some without window-, far from metro and buses, with an indifferent and plastic breakfast Hotel Re! does not a smart choice.

Reviews.Title: “vey comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: patricia25Adelaide
Reviews.Content: The only negative is that it is a bit out of the way of all the main hotel areas, (close to Chinatown though) so if we went out we had to plan it and most taxi drivers didn't know of it coming home. However, there were so many pluses: Being a smaller hotel it was more personal and comfortable. Only been operating as a hotel for 3 years or so. Quiet location. We got early check in at about 8.30-9am without any fuss. The extra 1/2 day at the end we paid for was so worth it with the late airline departure time. The hotel staff without exception were totally helpful charming and went out of their way to make things work for us. They have a regular free shuttle bus that takes guests to several popular locations. Taxis are quick and cheap, clean and AIRCONDITIONED!! Taxi drivers were all exceptionally delightful and patient. Rooms although small (ex student accommodation) had wild but interesting decor but were really comfortable and beds were oh so good, linen was good and finally after 4 weeks of travelling, so were the feather pillows. Room cleaning was of very high standard with all linen changed daily. Dinner was of a reasonable standard and manager took a lot of pride in his service. Breakfast, well what can I say, good coffee and cooking eggs... they don't get it. It was acceptable. A pool would have been a nice addition. We took it as part of Singapore airlines stopover deal and it was very good value with all the touristy add-ons

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: GraceNorthernEngland
Reviews.Content: Having arrived after a long flight were disgusted to be given a room in which someone had slept in the bed! and kindly urinated in the toilet without flushing it.After complaining and some considerable time we were eventually allocated another tiny room which had body fluid stains on the duvet-dont ask use your imagination uck but we could no longer be bothered to move again.A real shame because in general the staff wanted you to have a good time but cleanliness is everything to me I am afraid and I dont want to get into someone elses bed!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay only - say aaarrrheee! to the taxi driver!”
Reviews.Author: nippa1
Reviews.Content: Based on the excellent ratings on Trip Advisor we decided to try the Hotel Re! for 8 nights instead of a more conventional downtown chain. The Re! is certainly very clean with comfortable beds and although rooms can be small it offers reasonable value. These are room sizes as given to me Superior room - 14sq m Deluxe room - 18sq m Executive room - 20sq m Business room - 24sq m Premier room - 28sq m Family suite - 35sq m Themed suite - 35sq m We ended up with a deluxe which is about as small as I'd be prepared to rent for two people. Space in the bathroom was very limited. The hotel's trendy design may or may not be to your liking ( I like ! ) but it can't disguise that the Hotel is still a modified school. As you enter the building it looks like the YMCA. The absence of a garden or pool confirm this as a night stop retreat only and not somewhere you'd wish return to - to escape the midday sun. The slightly out of town location needn't be much of an issue. Taxis are quite cheap ( about 6S$ to town ) or a 5 minute downhill walkway to the Outram MRT station is easy if you're fit - remember the heat and gates at the hotel exit are locked at midnight. Also be aware that many taxi drivers have never heard of the new Hotel Re so you need to keep a map and address handy. Less happily we had an issue with the billing. I booked directly using the Hotel's own website and ordered a room with breakfast. On arrival things were not quite as agreed but we appeared to resolve the issue and continued our stay. On checkout the bill totals didn't appear unreasonable but the room rate had been crossed out and a higher one put in.It was suggested that I must have agreed to that as my signature was at the bottom of the sheet. I knew nothing of that alteration and had not initialled it. I don't think that there was any malpractice it just seemed that there was confusion over what the internet site lets you book and how they interpret things at the front desk. All I would suggest is that you check your bill carefully on arrival and at departure. To conclude the staff were generally helpful and friendly but no more that I would expect. The food was adequate. For us the killer was the cold atmosphere. It may be that the Feng Shui expert got it wrong but more likely that once a school always a school and the staff are perhaps inexperienced in genuine hospitality. There was no charm about the place. That extra oomph! that makes a great place to stay has nothing to do with start ratings. It's that feeling that you are surrounded by people who care and want you to experience the best. Sorry guys this hotel may suit the 2 day Twenty-something on a tight budget but us oldies have moved on!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves a special mention”
Reviews.Author: Roggly
Reviews.Content: Situated within a 10 minute walk from a centrally positioned underground stop. This no-frills hotel offers stylish, spotlessly clean and well manicured accommodation at a very reasonable price. Breakfast was not lavish but perfectly adequate with a good choice of European and Asian fare. The staff were charming, courteous and well informed. Complementary wireless Internet access from the rooms was a nice touch. Because our standard room was not ready on arrival we were immediately given an upgrade to a room that was !Even the courtesy bus went out of its way to be accommodating. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sidonie
Reviews.Content: I booked at the cheapest end of the scale because of an enforced Singapore Stopover due to flight connections, I had very little expectation. What a surprise, what an experience! Very new,spotless, friendly and helpful staff and a decor to cheer up anyone, young or old! The bar,run by Charlie, unfortunately closed at midnight,but just one chance of a drink on the lovely upper terrace overlooking Pearl Park. I had a day free and I could not have been in a better spot to take a leisurely walk through china town and lunch in the amazing Lau Pau Sat adjacent to Raffles Quay. then a walk through Merlion Park.a stroll around the river past the theatres, Parliament House to ClarkesQuay for a coffee or a drink at the many and various bars. The hotel gave me a late room departure gratis. Small rooms and shower only at the basic rate....but fantastic decor and fully equipped with occitane shampoos etc. But pay a little extra and you could find yourself in the James Bond or John Travolta Suite with supersized beds and baths! A fantastic find..forget Raffles and you could probably could stay a week for the same money!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: shir4z
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The 70's theme worked really well and made a nice change to the regular hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were lovely and clean. The hotel is only a year old so some taxi driver's do not know it's location. However if you are patient you will come across a taxi who does know where it is located. It is not too far from Chinatown. The metro is about 10 min walk from the hotel, its not too bad but can be annoying in humid conditions. Nice experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GaiC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Re! on the back on recommendations from other Tripadvisor reviews and I am glad I did. While the hotel was a little out of the centre of the city a regular shuttle bus was available and stopped at key locations around the city. In addition the outram is only a short walk although it is up hill on the way back to the hotel. Taxi's are inexpensive so getting around wasn't a problem. The room was very small but the hotel was very clean and the staff only to happy to help. All in all a good choice I thought and the free wifi a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by Re”
Reviews.Author: paletexan
Reviews.Content: In Singapore, i would be skeptical about a hotel room that is less than 100USD within decent distance of MRT. Hotel Re is just that, however it is new; and the rooms were very clean; and the hotel staff is very friendly. The lobby is a bit trendy, and the rooms are colorful; so this may not be for everyone. But the cleanliness and comfort transcend all; and the location near chinatown and the MRT is unbeatable. For those used to Western hotels, the room is smaller and suited for a dense city. The bathroom is also tight, but overall efficiently arranged. One tip for those seeking authentic food is to head out to the areas around the Chinatown MRT (not Outram Park) for various food stalls selling delicious food from fresh noodles to green mango salad. And also be sure to try the dessert place diagnol to McDonald's in Chinatown famous for their ice desserts. Trust me, you'll NEED it if not accustomed to the heat of SE Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad really....”
Reviews.Author: tanqr1982
Reviews.Content: Took on one of their staycation promotions as a post examinations reward. Location: Good enough for me. A 10min walk to Outram Park MRT Station. Just bear in mind that it's upslope, and you might want to reconsider the walk if you're returning in mid-afternoon. Hotel: Nicely decorated. No complaints Room: One of the nicer ones, at this price. The only real problem I had was with the air conditioning system. It wasn't cool enough, even though we had adjusted the thermostat to 18deg c, and the mode to high. Food: Small portions. Apart from that, good effort in the presentation and taste. I liked the wine bar, with its 1-for-1 promotion throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service together with butifully designed rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Kubistaa
Reviews.Content: We travel this begining of june together with my girlfriend to Paris with Emirates. We made our stop over for one night in SIngapore and after few reviews we decided to stay in this hotel. We arrived at 10am in a morning and receptionis did not have a room for as yet so she asked us to have a breakfast, so she can get room ready as soon as someone leave. It happend as she say at 11am we've been in our room, suprised by size and design of the rooms. Bathroom is haveing all the staff including a bath ropes and the hotel shoes. Shover is having a good water pressure (if you know what I mean) and ther is enough towels all around for 10 guests. The whole room is having realy nicely designed the lights and alarm controler, which you can either setup from your bad or from the door. As a sherry on a top there are to buttons right next to your bed which light the sighn outside of your door for ,,DO NOT DISTURB" or ... . I can't say anything wrong about the Hotel RE if we would decide to stop in Singapore again we wouldn't hasitate to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! - For the most part”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine_vj
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore early Nov last year and after a lot of research to find a hotel that was safe, clean and comfortable while fitting in our budget decided on Hotel Re!. There were not a whole of reviews at the time as it is a new hotel, but I had a couple of experienced travelers tell me that though the rooms are small we could expect a clean and comfortable place. So we went ahead and made the reservation and I was really hoping that it would turn out at least decent, since we were traveling with an infant. We got to the hotel around 3AM in the morning with a boatload of luggage and though we were not lucky enough to get an upgrade, we got the room we booked - a deluxe. It had a Queen bed, two chairs, flat screen TV mounted on wall, phone, mini bar, coffee maker, snacks and bottled water. I think an iron and ironing board too. The bathroom had a stand in shower and a wash and loo area. All the products were of the L'Occitane Verbena line, which I absolutely loved. The main thing that really impressed me was the cleanliness...so though the space was small compared to other hotels, we felt good about the room. The pack n play we were given was very clean too. Most of the staff were friendly and professional. And even though the room was small, we were able to manage well as they let us keep most of our luggage except what we wanted in their locker room, which was a big plus. About food, the only thing we had at the restaurant was Eggplant Parmigiana and it tasted heavenly. We were very impressed with it. Now for the cons, the Concierge could definitely have been much more knowledgeable and helpful. The shuttle seemed mythical to us, since in the 3 days were there (Fri, Sat & Sun), it was never available and the walk down the hill to the MRT station while carrying the baby, stroller, diaper bag etc...was painful. If they can fix these 2 things, the hotel for us was an absolute joy. On the whole, I would easily give the hotel a 4 out 5. Hopefully they will maintain the cleanliness and professionalism standards. P.S: - I don't have pictures, but I found some at http://rks-lifeasithappens.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, close to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: SchackStockholm
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. Rather intereresting design choices (neon green mixed with hot pink!). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice wine bar upstairs, wher you can also sit outside. Do not have breakfast, it's not at all up to par and the air-condition makes the dining room freezing. Other than this minor minus, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Of all the hotels I have stayed, this was the worst”
Reviews.Author: Balaclava79
Reviews.Content: Thought it was fun to get hotel room just for an overnight stay with my gf, and found Hotel Re!'s 50% on its room rates. Hence I decided rashly and booked a themed suite (the one with the jacuzzi) for a night's stay. Till now I am still wondering why I did it. The hotel was a little too challenging to find. Gotta thank Mighty Minds for the trusty old street directory. Upon reaching Hotel Re!, I must admit their front desk staff (2 friendly ladies when i checked) was its only saving grace. They made check-in a breeze, not much of the "er"s & "huh"s like other 5 star hotels I have stayed with. The 1st suite I was led to, had a faulty card slot i.e the "thing" tat you slot your hotel key into when one enters a hotel room. The door stopper was also dislodged, exposing the sharps screws which were in danger of piercing my bare feet. Waited a good 10-15mins before I confirmed it was genuinely faulty. So I proceeded back to the front desk to highlight this matter, since it took quite a while for help to come after a call to the front desk. Btw forgot to mention one of my key cards was faulty as well. The front desk tried to expeditiously resolve this matter by offer me another room. Though the 2nd room did manage light it up, it came with problems as well. The 2nd room did light up (Huge sigh of relief!) But after a look around the room, it also came with major faults Firstly, there was a misplaced ceiling panel, leaving a gaping hole above my head. I would have been fine with it, if helmets were a prerequisite to enter a hotel room Secondly, my jacuzzi was unusable as its stopper was missing!! Argh! Back to the front desk I went to highlight these matters. Thank God I was smart enough to leave my stuff in the car before proceeding to my room. Anyway decided not to wait to settle down in my room and left the hotel compounds for dinner. This time I discovered things that I took for granted in my other hotel stays. The toilet didn't have any soap, ended up washing my hands with the L'Occitane body wash.. The room also didn't have any utensils like fork or spoon, only teaspoons. Mind you, not all food products can be consumed with a spoon! Sadly I also realized later in the night that computer usage is also chargeable, regardless of room type. Guess the only benefit of having a suite was the jacuzzi. Finally, I was late for check out, over slept due to all the disappointments I had the day before. Thankfully the front desk staff was flexible enough not to implement any surcharge, which I am definitely grateful for. For cost of this room, even with 50% off, I would have gone to any other hotel and gotten a premium room or club room. Hotel Re! Re!fund - I don't think so Re!imbursements - Guess "I am sorry" is pretty much it Re!gret - Definitely

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel......would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: alohasps
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel.....taxi driver had never heard of it. Very clean. Very Quiet Next to a park and a short walk to train, they had shuttle I very rarely used. Exactly like web site. Staff very professional Really nothing more to add.....

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but away from center,”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Good Deal, very small rooms and away from center, but for 25 bucks a day in taxis you can pretty much go anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An experience we will not Re-peat”
Reviews.Author: Stonefee
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: the decor is different, especially in this part of the world; location is good for Chinatown and Clarke's Quay is within walking distance (15-20 mins); MRT station 10 minutes walk; attentive and friendly barman running the very underused hotel bar; L'Occitane shower gels and shampoo, which my wife tells me are high-end bathing products. The bad: Upon arrival, the manager tells us he doesn't have a double room available (even though we showed him the confirmation that we had booked a double). His attitude was virtually couldn't care less. There was no apology. Upon my insisting he says he will see what he can do as the hotel is apparently fully booked. When I checked the following day all he could offer us was a windowless double room. We had booked via an agent (Air Asia package) so perhaps the price wasn't as high as the hotel might charge someone who comes in off the street, but that does not excuse shoving us in cheaper rooms. The compact rooms include an en suite but the air con unit is piped to allow water vapour to flow into the bathroom. This results in a large puddle of water right in the middle of the WC and wash facilities (see photos). It would have been more sensible to pipe into the separate shower area if anywhere, but instead you have to wade through water every time you want to use the loo or wash your hands. When we raised this with the hotel the solution of the housekeeper was to keep a bathmat on the floor at all times. Consequently that bathmat was totally sodden at all times. I hasten to add that the housekeeper was very pleasant and polite and was clearly used to this issue being raised, but the "solution" was far from adequate. Of the twin beds, one of the covers was heavily stained. Though changed immediately upon my raising a complaint, it should not have been left on the bed in the first place. The kitsch decor suggests a sense of fun which is sadly lacking from the staff members, particularly the duty manager. It's rather jarring to see a hotel marketed as a fun and trendy place populated by certain members of staff who are po-faced, sullen and unhelpful. Of course not all the staff are bad, but this was sufficiently bad an experience for me to be able to recommend that the place be avoided. Overall, not the worst place we've stayed, but far from the 'zany fun palace' that other reviewers would have you believe.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed May 5 and 6 2009”
Reviews.Author: drewmeister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Re! on our way back to the US from Malaysia. It was a shortish walk from the train station and, although we knew the way to walk, the signs were helpful. The staff were more than efficient...Upon check in, I asked for a quiet room, as I am a light sleeper...Bingo, they gave us a 4th floor room on the park side. It was very quiet and appreciated. We called housekeeping for an iron and ironing board, and a staff person literally was at our door with them within 3 minutes. The room was very clean, but the lime green color scheme was interesting. When we checked in, they had some workers doing some refurbishing in the elevators, which reeked of chemical adhesives. This did not last long, thankfully. We are big walkers, and Chinatown was a short walk away. We didn't need our room cleaned, and we were not disturbed. One curious thing, though. We needed a 5AM cab ride to catch our plane. We asked how much the fare should be. We were told that it was about S$25, so we planned accordingly. The cab was on time, and speed racer got us to the airport very quickly. The meter read $23, so I was pretty happy, until the driver hit a little button and S$48 came up. There is a S$25 surcharge for cab rides between midnight and 6AM. We had enough cash to pay, but it would have been helpful to be informed of this before hand. Lastly, the hotel's internet is something like S$10.70 per hour with taxes, and is very high speed. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, staff great”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjo49
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 5 days on way back from oz. This was ideal for us as we like to be away from busy area's but we only had a 5 minute walk to the railway station. A shuttle bus was provided a few times a day but we preferred to walk. The hotel has been refurbished from an office block, but has been very well done. It is a bit modern in the decor but everything was clean and comfortable. The room was great with a/c and a small fridge and tea/coffee making facilities, nothing was too much trouble for the staff especially the chap in the wine bar!!. One point to bear in mind, the concierge staff were reluctant to book us the airport shuttle and suggested a taxi, they probably get some sort of payoff. We persisted and were very pleased with the result. The hotel doesn't have a pool which is a bit disappointing when the temp. is in the 30's. Perhaps they could consider adding one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: - close to Outram Park MRT station (using the back entrance and walking through the park area. - fast check in, upgraded to a bigger room, on the 12th floor overlooking the park. Nice and quiet. Friendly and helpful staff. - Room is quite nice – very clean and modern. No complaints about the room at all. Very good air conditioning (thank goodness in the Singapore heat and humidity). Nice modern bathroom, with quality toiletries. - Breakfast is varied, with some changes to the hot dishes every day. Their coffee is excellent, freshly brewed on demand à l’Europe. Had café au lait at every breakfast. - only drawback is lack of restaurants, shops and convenience stores nearby. A plus is the quiet location of the hotel. - Free unlimited in the room WiFi is great. - Could have another light near the desk as the room is somewhat dark. - A surprise was the need to agree to have SGD50 per day pre authorized on Visa even though we had completely prepaid our stay. The amount is only a pre-authorization. When asked for confirmation that the deposit was unlocked, we were told not too worry and no receipt was issued. - Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, unusual, clean, hotel”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: Nice and close to Outram MRT if you know the shortcut, this hotel is a very unusual hotel (my room was bright green, incidentally). Everything worked beautifully in the well-appointed room; I was rather pleased (arriving at 11.00pm) that there was a good spicy noodle meal available in the room. Wifi is excellent; you get CNN, BBC World News and Channel NewsAsia on the television (in English), and the bathroom was splendidly clean and functional. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “REjoice .... this is the most REpeatable and RElaxing REtro 4-star hotel experience in SIN”
Reviews.Author: lesleyrimington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted we choose "Hotel Re!" for our stopover and would definately stay there again. We were looking for somewhere cheaper than the usual 5 star hotel rates for SIN, but did not want to risk staying in a 3 star hotel. We also wanted a Hotel that has individual character, is clean and functional and conveniently located. Hotel Re! managed to deliver all of this and more. The hotel looked exactly as it presented on their website and the owners have successfully recreated an interesting 60's feel about it throughout. We liked the zanny way, they utilised their "Re" branding on fittings and furnishings and have used this to name all the hotel services such as "Re-vive" (restaurant), "Re-lax" (Spa) etc. When we checked in and asked for a purple room (because that is my favorite colour), we were upgraded without any further charge, which we thought was a very nice touch. Our room had all sorts of interesting nooks and crannies and was very hip with padded silver head board and purple people sillouette on wall. The bed was very comfortable and had a useful electronic control panel on the bedside table for lights, a/c, etc. The suite also had a modern large flat screen TV, free internet connection and a panoramic view of the city. The ensuite bathroom was very nice too with an open plan shower, frosted glass doors and purple tiles. We could not fault the service and all the staff we encountered were efficient, pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a funky room with a view”
Reviews.Author: scratchitoff
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly and well situated, overlooking a large green space, unusual for Singapore, minutes walk from the MRT transport system and has a shuttle bus to and from. The rooms are modern, everything works properly, there is free fast wireless internet and a plasma tv. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience; will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetbaby
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Re! based on the excellent reviews posted earlier. We are so glad we stayed @ Re! for the following reasons: 1) Booking office accommodated our request for rebooking to get a lower rate, no questions asked. 2) Upon arrival, I reminded the receptionist that we wanted a double bed. She put us in a deluxe room, with bathtub, @ no extra cost. 3) Toiletries provided are L'Occitane, an expensive brand. 4) The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were fluffy. 5) Wi-fi is free and fast. 6) The TV is LCD, though there are just a few English channels. 7) Local calls are free. 8) They have free shuttle buses to specific points within the area (Outram MRT station, Clarke Quay, etc.). 9) The hotel is just a 5-minute walk to the Outram MRT station. Though it is near a busy road, the noise did not reach our room on the 6th floor. We were able to sleep soundly at night. 10) The lift is spacious and clean. 11) The lobby and other decors are funky. 12) You can borrow umbrellas in case there is rain. They lent us one on our first day when it rained hard. One minor blemish is that the restaurant does not operate 24 hours. We almost did not make it when we went for a late dinner at 10 PM. They still accommodated us though. Another complaint is that our bath robes were not replaced daily. You have to explicitly put the robes on the tub to remind the housekeeping staff that you want the towels and robes replaced. Once, we forgot to do so because we were in a hurry to go out. We left our robe on the bed. When we got back, we found the same robe folded on our bed. However, these are just small issues that can be easily attended to by the hotel, should their attention be called. Overall, we had a fantastic time and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer_CY
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. It's trendy, retro and stylish. The hotel is on top of a big hill, which I belive is apart of a Park, which makes it even more beautiful. The hotel opened in May of 2008 I believe, and used to be a school for children - like a private school, so the rooms are smaller. But the hotel and rooms were very clean and they provided all the tolletries. The bed and pillows were super comfy. The service was great, they were all very nice. And the shuttle was a plus. They were kind enough to hold a couple of our luggages as we wanted to travel to Kuala Lumpur, and then pick them back up on our way to the airport. Stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price in Singapore, clean , 70s retro”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Hotel Re for 3 nights in February. Though there were no interconnecting rooms available so we had 2 rooms next door to each other. Yes, the rooms are small, (shoe boxes really) and yes our rooms were yellow with fushia cupboards and gold tiles in the bath room - but this was more than made up for by the cleanliness of the room and the friendly service from all the staff especially the concierge. Location wise the nearest MRT station is just at the bottom of the hill and a short walk away - one stop away from the cable cars to Sentosa Island! Chinatown is a short walk away too and the river and Clarke Quay only a 10 minute walk as well. But let's face it taxis are cheap in Singapore and the trains are air conditioned, clean and on time - the location was not an issue for us. We often visit Singapore as a close family member lives there and we would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Re again!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: cgarces
Reviews.Content: Booking was made online so I wasn't sure what to expect. My only impressions of Re were from photos and reviews on the Net. Wasn't too hard to locate (most taxi drivers know the area but not the exact location of the hotel since its was still quite new). The location might not seem the greatest but you can take short walk by the park to get to Outram MRT. Check-in went pretty smooth and they gave me an upgrade (superior to deluxe) when my preferred room wasn't available but they offered to change my room again as soon as one was. Room was still quite small, but clean and comfortable. Like the entire hotel, the room design was interesting and I didn't mind the bright colours and silhouette art on the wall. Service was good during my stay. Everyone was friendly and showed no reluctance in my requests. Housekeeping did a good job, room service was quick and the guy at concierge even got the shuttle bus to send me to Cineleisure when a cab was not available although generally, calling up a cab is not a problem - usually just a 5 min wait. My favourite though was the bartender - friendly guy, made good conversation while I waited at the bar for friends and did his job very well. I forgot his name but thumbs up to him. The cafe/restaurant didn't seem to be operational all the time and I was also informed that spa services were only available through bookings. Neither mattered to me though. Only drawback was that I found the price a bit steep. Re does not provide as many facilities as other hotels for that price, but I liked that fact that it was new, things were clean and the staff effective.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Check-in But Otherwise Brilliant. Very Funky!”
Reviews.Author: Markyh77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6.40am and requested an early check-in (previously requested on our internet booking, but somehow lost). There was a slow check-in with a lot of paperwork/proof of ID required. At first the Shift Manager wanted to charge us a half day rate to check in immediately, or otherwise wait for an hour or two to check in when a clean room was available, so we chose to wait. We sat down to a lovely buffet breakfast, and from that point on the experience was excellent. Our room was ready by 8.15am at no extra charge. The room was small but functional, otherwise spotless with a lovely bathroom and big LCD TV. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom freebies were cute. The staff attended to all our needs, and the concierge was very helpful. The hotel itself was well located and spotless in presentation. We loved the funky decor and the Bruce Lee silhouettes in our room. The additional charges (for phone, mini-bar etc) were surprisingly cheap. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CK617Boston
Reviews.Content: I simply love the interior design of the lobby and the room I had was tastefully done up. A lot of care and thought went into the placement of key furniture and fixture pieces. The L'Occitaine and other toiletries (bath salt was a godsend after a long day of walking in the hot and humid Singapore weather) were definitely a nice touch. As are the pair of japanese white slippers. Housekeeping kept the room in an excellent condition. The bed was nice, the comforter (an overkill) and the a/c system was quieter than most hotel rooms I have been in. The check-in process was done professionally and quickly. Checking out was easy (I had a 4 am check out!) and a cab was called on my behalf by the friendly corceige. I can't say I like the restaurant or the exhorbitant price I was charged for an "American" breakfast buffet. Seriously guys, the quality wasn't that good nor was there much to choose from. The 2nd floor bar which has both indoor and outdoor seating, was empty most of the time I was there. Overall, this certainly isn't the Ritz, but boy, do I love this cute and quirkyly designed hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay and will definitely return for another stay (and yeah, I can do without the Ritz).

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Faerie81
Reviews.Content: I booked through Asiatravel.com two weeks before our 1 night stay for celebrating new year eve. i have book two superior rooms for me & my friends for our stay. First problem, we encounter is the servicing male staff isn't very friendly enough. And the check-in is very slow. Secondly, our room didn't have double bed that we requested. And the staff didn't apologised or given us other alternatives as we can always upgrade or choose better rooms. Thirdly, there isn't personalized checked in. It is not a very good experience there as being a local to visit a local boutique hotel in singapore. Maybe i should not expecting much as it not classified as 4 or 5 stars hotel. Firstly it caught my attention cos it is being aired on channel U program promo on this hotel by mediacrop artists. After experiencing it for this hotel, I don't think i will ever book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyhchen
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Re. This hotel is very boutique like. Rooms are small, but nicely decorated. Bed is comfortable. Water pressure for shower is good. I love the L'occitane toiletries. They offer free wireless internet! The service from lobby staff is pretty good. They even let me borrow an umbrella on a rainy day. Overall, it's good value for the money charged. This is not a high end 5* hotel like the Ritz and Four Seasons. If you come with the right expectation, you'll have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Maj10
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel, thinking i had booked the hotel over the internet, but something had gone wrong. The staff was very helpful and managed to get me room. The room was very nice, it was tiny but i liked it. The hotel was original, bright colors and nothing bad to say at all. The only thing i can comment on is that there was no handsoap in my room. Oher then that, a very nice hotel, very helpful staff and made an overall good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Scatwich
Reviews.Content: First time to Singapore and had only 1 night. Booked through Agoda rooms - cost approx £80 the night - midweek. Well located - only 5 minutes' walk from Clarke Quay. Nearest metro station Outram Park ony 5 mins if you go through Pearl's Hill park. Very new - so all very clean, It's got a look - if you like that look. I booked a single room - small but perfectly formed. No complaints at all - oh except don't expect a great breakfast. OK for toast jam, coffee and cereal. Staff very friendly, Would recommend. I even took some photos for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and cool room design”
Reviews.Author: WaynePhuketThailand
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect as some reviews were mixed. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean and well organized the rooms are with large LCD TV. The staff are very helpful. Grace from front desk was helpful from the first minuet of arriving and we even got a double upgrade!!1 Its only 5 mins walk across the park via the rear exit to the nearest MRT stop Outram. From here we bought a 3 day pass and found Bugis Junction to be a good place for bargain shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my 18days stay at Hotel Re!”
Reviews.Author: Sakuraii
Reviews.Content: The service at Hotel Re! is over the top. its a small/boutique hotel but has everything one would need. Its not close to the shopping districts but there s MRT within 10min walk via a quiet park.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjangles
Reviews.Content: New hotel so everything feels, well, new and unused. Rooms are quite small (the only place to open your suitcase is on the bed), but well appointed with nice big flatscreen TVs. Decor is 70's retro (my room had silhouettes of Bruce Lee on the wall. Good Location is close to Chinatown so you can eat cheap and Chinatown MRT station is maybe 3 min. walk away Everything's new Bed's comfortable Nice flat screen TVs in rooms Staff friendly Good value for money FREE wireless (why can't all hotels be like this) Bad Only have blinds on windows so light gets in, not good if you like to sleep in complete darkness like I do. Also annoying in the morning as the sun streaks through Breakfast is pretty repetitive and boring Restaurant overprices Massage place closed even during hours when it should be open. Also closes too early (10pm) No pool or gym (but across from a park if you want to run/walk/sit around

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate!!!”
Reviews.Author: karel57
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a great place. Yes the rooms are small but they are immaculate. The towels and linen were really high quality. Even the bath soap wasn't the usual hotel standard, but rather a devine smelling body wash. The staff were really friendly and polite. The housekeeping staff even took the time to show us the short-cut to the MRT. The hotel courtesy bus was a real bonus and the drivers always ensured we knew how to get to our planned destination. I would definitely stay here again.
